SoloFates_Astarion.synopsis: The morning after the climax of the game - Avatar Astarion has defeated the Netherbrain and is now in a room in the Elfsong Tavern, thinking about what comes next.

SoloFates_Gale.synopsis: Avatar Gale has a moment of reflection by himself in a room in the elfsong tavern, shortly after the battle for Baldur's Gate and defeat of the Netherbrain. This dialogue serves to offer the chance to decide the crown's fate for players who didn't get the chance to do this in combat over. It reuses a lot of lines from that dialogue VO-wise, but cinematically feel free to adjust the shots/poses as needed.

RomanceFates_Gale.synopsis: Gale speaks with his love interest player in a private bedroom upstairs at an inn. They've saved the world and just spent the night together. Now they take a moment to discuss what's in store for them. Gale will either:- Wish to retrieve a powerful (and dangerous) artefact that was lost during the climactic battle- Wish to return to his life in Waterdeep.

KarlachInAvernus.synopsis: In this post-credits sequence, Karlach and the player arrive in Avernus. She's still stuck in the middle of the Blood War, but she is, at least, alive. She quickly realizes her engine is 'fixed' as long as she stays down here and rapidly goes through the stages of grief to accpeting that she's back where she swore she'd never go - but at least she's in her element. Kicking ass, fucking shit up - and this  time, she has someone she loves with her. Maybe this could work after all... at least for now.Tone here is optimistic, though ambiguous. Is this a good ending? A bad ending? Something in the middle? No matter what, we want to show Karlach at the height of her coolness. This is not our goofy dork; this is a powerhouse who knows how to survive, no matter what, and may even have fun this time around. Clint Karlach Eastwood mixed with 80s action star. Bring it on, baby.

EvilEnding.synopsis: In the final decision of what to do with the Netherbrain, the player decided to become the Absolute.

TheHerosRevelry.synopsis: Scene after DestructionOfTheBrain and before CombatOver showing the citiziens of Baldur's Gate reclaiming their city from the mind flayer threat.

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice.synopsis: Laezel Avatar gets to decide their future after the Githyanki have already left.
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice.how_to_trigger: If Laezel is one of the avatars and doesn't lead the Combat Over dialog, this dialog will play immediately after Combat Over.

SoloFates_Wyll.synopsis: Wyll avatar reflects on his fate in the endgame.

WithersGathersCompanions_KarlachAvatar.synopsis: Withers is in his chapel, approaching a row of flickering candles. This is the Avatar Karlach version of END_GameFinale_WithersGathersCompanions.

RomanceFates_Wyll.synopsis: Path in epilogue when players have one last moment with their romance partner.Wyll could be1. The Blade of Frontiers2, The Blade of Avernus3. Grand DukeIn all three cases, he may or may not be pacted, and he may or may not look like a devil.

ROM_RomanceFates_Astarion.synopsis: Astarion and the player he's in a romantic relationship with talk in a private bedroom in an inn, the morning after spending the night together after saving the world. A discussion of what comes next ensues, varying depending on how Astarion's story unfolded. He could:- Have killed Cazador and taken power to become the Vampire Ascendant.- Have killed Cazador and stayed a spawn (with reactivity to whether or not he killed the Spawn Prisoners.)- Not killed Cazador.

RaphaelCrownUpdate.synopsis: After WithersChronicles, if the player made the deal with Raphael (the Orphic Hammer in exchange for the Crown of Karsus), Raphael shows up to report back on how that went.

RomanceFates_Halsin.synopsis: Halsin addresses a player to whom he's romantically linked  in a private room in the Elfsong tavern. They discuss what comes next. This scene occurs shortly after the final victory over the absolute, a day or so after the battle. Player and Halsin are implied to have spent the night together.

DeathofKarlach.synopsis: Karlach's death scene. The tone for this is, for me, raw and real. Karlach is not in good shape here; the engine is burning her up, and she's soon to die.She may or may not be a mindflayer, she dies regardless.

SoloFates_Laezel.synopsis: Lae'zel solo avatar reflects on events.

SoloFates_CustomAvatar.synopsis: Custom ending for Cured Dark Urge

SequeToElfsong.synopsis: The purpose of this scene is to:a) lift our spirits in the case that we have just seen sad things like companions leaving / Karlach dying b) segue visually to the Elfsong Tavern where the Fates scenes will take place (on certain paths)It is possible this is the last scene we see before Credits.

RomanceFates_Minthara.synopsis: Player and Minthara wake up in a private room at the Elfsong tavern, having spent the night together after saving the city and destroying the netherbrain. Minthara is a little bit upset that the player didn't seize control of the brain and become the new Absolute, but she's in love with them and forgives them. And then dreams about their next conquests.

RomanceFates_Shadowheart.synopsis: Shadowheart and her love interest player talk in a private bedroom in an inn, the morning after spending the night together after saving the world. A discussion of what comes next ensues, varying depending on how Shadowheart's story unfolded. She could:- have remained committed to Shar and have sacrificed her parents. She is now in charge of Shar's church.- she could have abandoned Shar at the last moment and saved her parents- she could have turned from Shar in Act 2, and set out on a mission to save her parents in Act 3, rescuing them- she could have turned from Shar in Act 2, and set out on a mission to save her parents in Act 3, but instead euthanized them to free them from Shar's curse.- none of the above are applicable, and she is aware she has unfinished (and undefined) business she needs to tend to.

SoloFates_Shadowheart.synopsis: Avatar Shadowheart has a moment of reflection by herself in a room in the elfsong tavern, the night after the battle for Baldur's Gate and defeat of the Netherbrain. She considers what comes next, with reactivity for how her personal story played out.

RomanceFates_DarkUrge.synopsis: Dark Urge with Withers meant to communicate the incoherency of the final stage of DU with Withers

Remembrance.synopsis: The final section of the Companion Fates scene where the fallen characters are remembered.

RomanceFates_Laezel.synopsis: Romance fate with Lae'zel. Only occurs if Lae'zel has chosen to stay in Faerun.1. Because player convinced Orpheus path Lae'zel to stay even after sacrificing orpheus.2. Because player convinced her to stay on Faerun.Otherwise she has left to fight for Orpheus / ascend to Vlaakith.

SoloFates_Astarion_1.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_1.text: *You come to slowly, the events of recent days drifting back in fragments, like a half-remembered dream.*

SoloFates_Astarion_54.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_54.text: *Your mind is quiet, finally free of the parasite's control, but your body is thrumming with power.*

SoloFates_Astarion_70.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_70.text: *Power that is now fully unleashed and yours to command. All you have to do is decide what you're doing with it.*

SoloFates_Astarion_28.speaker: Player
SoloFates_Astarion_28.text: Well, obviously I'm going to rule Baldur's Gate. What else?

SoloFates_Astarion_26.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_26.text: *You picture the city, its politics and power structures, its beating heart. It would be so easy to bite into it and make it your own.*

SoloFates_Astarion_43.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_43.text: *Not to rule as a tyrant, of course. You don't need a throne - you can rule quietly from the shadows.*

SoloFates_Astarion_30.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_30.text: *Although... you wouldn't say 'no' to a throne. But not yet.*

SoloFates_Astarion_49.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_49.text: *There's no need to rush things after all - you have an eternity to play with. And you're going to have some fun.*
SoloFates_Astarion_49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion breaks into a big, fangy smile.

SoloFates_Astarion_39.speaker: Player
SoloFates_Astarion_39.text: I should start creating my own vampire spawn. I'll need the help to subjugate Baldur's Gate.

SoloFates_Astarion_38.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_38.text: *With all of Baldur's Gate to choose from, your servants could be the cream of the crop. Although...*

SoloFates_Astarion_36.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_36.text: *You have met some very powerful people recently - even called some of them friends. Perhaps they could be... convinced?*
SoloFates_Astarion_36.context: NodeContext: "...convinced?" You're more than happy to turn them into vampires by force if you need to

SoloFates_Astarion_19.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_19.text: *You smile as your mind turns over one possibility after another, each scheme more devious and bloody than the last.*

SoloFates_Astarion_45.speaker: Player
SoloFates_Astarion_45.text: My companions have grown strong. Perhaps a purge is in order, before they become a threat...

SoloFates_Astarion_20.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_20.text: *If they can destroy the Netherbrain, perhaps they'll think they can destroy the Vampire Ascendant.*

SoloFates_Astarion_14.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_14.text: *And now that Shadowheart has the ear of her god... yes, perhaps it's best if they were removed from the equation.*

SoloFates_Astarion_29.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_29.text: *And Wyll as the Grand Duke of Baldur's Gate? Well that's just ridiculous - he'll have to go.*

SoloFates_Astarion_4.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_4.text: *Especially when one of them is the Blade of Avernus. Yes, he'll have to go.*

SoloFates_Astarion_16.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_16.text: *As you run through an ever-growing list of potential enemies, you smile quietly to yourself.*

SoloFates_Astarion_31.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_31.text: *The future is going to be very, very dangerous. And an awful lot of fun.*
SoloFates_Astarion_31.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion breaks into a big, fangy smile.

SoloFates_Astarion_17.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_17.text: *Yes, perhaps it is best if they were... removed from the equation.*

SoloFates_Astarion_22.speaker: Player
SoloFates_Astarion_22.text: Perhaps I'll see what else this world has to offer.

SoloFates_Astarion_41.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_41.text: *There's enough out there that it would take a thousand lifetimes to see it all. Thankfully, you may have a thousand lifetimes to spare.*

SoloFates_Astarion_68.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_68.text: *Your mind is finally quiet, free of the parasite. You revel in a moment's peace before an old tension starts to rise in your chest.*

SoloFates_Astarion_59.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_59.text: *Somewhere in this city, your old master is lurking, waiting to reassert his control over you.*

SoloFates_Astarion_3.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_3.text: *He might wait days or years, but he will come for you. Your reckoning is inevitable.*

SoloFates_Astarion_63.speaker: Player
SoloFates_Astarion_63.text: Let him come. I have powerful friends.

SoloFates_Astarion_53.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_53.text: *If you've proved nothing else recently, it's that together you can achieve the impossible.*

SoloFates_Astarion_34.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_34.text: *Especially if you have Shar's right hand on your side.*

SoloFates_Astarion_18.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_18.text: *Especially if you have the Grand Duke of Baldur's Gate on your side.*

SoloFates_Astarion_46.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_46.text: *The future seems... well, not 'bright', but certainly not as dark as it could be.*

SoloFates_Astarion_44.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_44.text: *Especially if you have the Blade of Avernus on your side.*

SoloFates_Astarion_62.speaker: Player
SoloFates_Astarion_62.text: If I can beat a Netherbrain, I can kill one vampire.

SoloFates_Astarion_2.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_2.text: *And who's to say that if you faced him, you wouldn't still be able to resist? If all this has taught you nothing else, it's that anything is possible.*

SoloFates_Astarion_35.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_35.text: *Who knows, you might even make a habit of it? You could see yourself as a famous slayer of vampires - a freer of spawn.*

SoloFates_Astarion_9.speaker: Player
SoloFates_Astarion_9.text: It's a big world out there. He can't control me if he can't find me.

SoloFates_Astarion_61.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_61.text: *The Sword Coast alone has a hundred places you could disappear, never mind the vast lands to the east.*

SoloFates_Astarion_10.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_10.text: *There's an almost endless world for you to explore. Even if you can only see it at night.*

SoloFates_Astarion_37.speaker: Player
SoloFates_Astarion_37.text: I wonder if the Gur are still open to working together...

SoloFates_Astarion_23.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_23.text: *You consider the fate of their children once they fell into Cazador's grasp...*

SoloFates_Astarion_69.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_69.text: *No. No, you doubt they'll want to do you any favours.*

SoloFates_Astarion_40.speaker: Player
SoloFates_Astarion_40.text: If only the Gur weren't all dead. Maybe they could have helped.

SoloFates_Astarion_58.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_58.text: *Well, what's done is done. This is hardly the time for regrets.*

SoloFates_Astarion_21.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_21.text: *Perhaps it's best to just lie low for a while. Go out and see the world, maybe?*

SoloFates_Astarion_72.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_72.text: *There will be dangers aplenty, of course, but what's life without a little danger?*
SoloFates_Astarion_72.context: NodeContext: Ending with relish in your voice. Danger is FUN after all.

SoloFates_Astarion_60.speaker: Player
SoloFates_Astarion_60.text: That's a problem for another day.

SoloFates_Astarion_51.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_51.text: *Your mind is quiet, free from the parasite and Cazador both. You're not sure you've ever known peace like it.*

SoloFates_Astarion_67.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_67.text: *But like everything, there was a cost.*

SoloFates_Astarion_27.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_27.text: *You can feel it in the pit of your stomach - the knowledge you'll never feel the warm sun on your skin again.*

SoloFates_Astarion_73.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_73.text: *Still, you are free. Your future is finally your own. Now you just have to decide what to do with it.*

SoloFates_Astarion_47.speaker: Player
SoloFates_Astarion_47.text: Being a hero suits me, maybe I'll stick with it. For now.

SoloFates_Astarion_32.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_32.text: *Astarion - Hero of Baldur's Gate. You rather like the sound of that.*

SoloFates_Astarion_12.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_12.text: *A hero's life won't be an easy one, of course. You'll have to face down every beast, fiend, and lunatic out there, all while dodging assassination attempts, plots, and intrigue.*

SoloFates_Astarion_11.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_11.text: *Your life will be nothing but one night of peril after another - a bloody cascade of violence that will leave a trail of bodies everywhere you go.*

SoloFates_Astarion_24.speaker: Player
SoloFates_Astarion_24.text: I could always join my siblings in the Underdark.

SoloFates_Astarion_52.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_52.text: *Perhaps, although who knows how warm your welcome will be after you killed all those spawn in the cells...*

SoloFates_Astarion_50.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_50.text: *Perhaps, although who knows how warm your welcome will be after you left all those spawn to rot in the cells...*

SoloFates_Astarion_66.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_66.text: *Still, they're family. You're sure they'll come around.*

SoloFates_Astarion_55.speaker: Player
SoloFates_Astarion_55.text: I could always check in on the spawn in the Underdark. All 7,000 of them...

SoloFates_Astarion_0.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_0.text: *You think of the thousands of souls down waiting in the Underdark. Lost, leaderless...*

SoloFates_Astarion_57.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_57.text: *You led so many of them into the dark. Who's to say you're not the one to lead them back to the light?*

SoloFates_Astarion_65.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_65.text: *Whether you settle in the Underdark or find somewhere more fitting, you're sure the future won't be easy.*

SoloFates_Astarion_8.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_8.text: *You'll have to feed, move through the world relying on your wits, and avoid the many people who'll want to kill you. It will be very, very dangerous.*

SoloFates_Astarion_15.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_15.text: *'Yes,' you think to yourself. 'This is going to be fun.'*
SoloFates_Astarion_15.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion breaks into a big, fangy smile.

SoloFates_Astarion_6.speaker: Player
SoloFates_Astarion_6.text: Who says I'll never walk in the sun again? There may still be a way, if I can find it.

SoloFates_Astarion_56.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_56.text: *Being able to walk into the sun is a nice idea, but clearly impossible.*

SoloFates_Astarion_33.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_33.text: *Then again, you've done the impossible half a dozen times recently. Who's to say you don't have one last miracle left in you?*

SoloFates_Astarion_48.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_48.text: *'Yes,' you think. Your answer is out there somewhere. And you're going to have fun finding it.*
SoloFates_Astarion_48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion breaks into a big, fangy smile.

SoloFates_Astarion_71.speaker: Player
SoloFates_Astarion_71.text: I could travel - see the world.

SoloFates_Astarion_42.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_42.text: *All these years alive and you have spent almost all of them trapped in the same wretched palace.*

SoloFates_Astarion_5.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_5.text: *Yes, you'd rather like to see what else the world has to offer.*

SoloFates_Astarion_13.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_13.text: *You'll have to see it after dark, of course - when murder, theft, and all manner of lust and debauchery rule the night.*

SoloFates_Astarion_64.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Astarion_64.text: *But of course, you wouldn't have it any other way.*

SoloFates_Gale_4.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Gale_4.text: *The Netherbrain is defeated, Faerûn is saved, but where you should feel peace you feel only the orb. Restless. Hungry. Yearning.*
SoloFates_Gale_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale stands at a window, looking out over the Chionthar. If possible, a shot of the Chionthar.

SoloFates_Gale_39.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Gale_39.text: *The Crown is in the depths of the Chionthar. If you salvage the stones, you could claim it, reforge it, and revive the power of Netheril anew.*
SoloFates_Gale_39.context: InternalNodeContext: KNOWS ABOUT REFORGING CROWNNodeContext: Speaking of Gale, who knows that he could reforge the Crown of Karsus - the very thing that allowed the Netherbrain to be dominated and become the Netherbrain

SoloFates_Gale_16.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Gale_16.text: *Mystra's summons still stands. Bring the Crown to her and she may yet offer you a cure, but there is no guarantee that she will be in a forgiving mood.*
SoloFates_Gale_16.context: InternalNodeContext: Knows Mystra wants to speak to youNodeContext: Gale weighing internally pros and cons of doing what Mystra says

SoloFates_Gale_6.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Gale_6.text: *You could take the Crown to Mystra, perhaps leverage it for a cure. But there is no guarantee that she will be in a forgiving mood.*
SoloFates_Gale_6.context: NodeContext: Gale weighing internally pros and cons of interacting with Mystra at this critical juncture

SoloFates_Gale_36.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Gale_36.text: *Already you feel the orb straining against the confines of Elminster's spell. It will not hold forever. How will you spend the time that you have left?*

SoloFates_Gale_49.speaker: Player
SoloFates_Gale_49.text: It's time the Crown had a new owner - you. The wizard that defeated the Netherbrain.

SoloFates_Gale_12.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Gale_12.text: *The very air around you thrums with anticipation, and fear. Can you really handle such power, such authority?*
SoloFates_Gale_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale contemplating his newfound power, feeling his isolation from his surroundings and his partyNodeContext: speaking of Gale, who is fairly sure he's about to become a god

SoloFates_Gale_59.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Gale_59.text: *Whyever not? After all, you are an illithid - whatever flaws plagued you as a human are long behind you now.*
SoloFates_Gale_59.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale in Illithid form, flexing his Illithid magic, interwoven with Karsite magicInternalNodeContext: ILLITHID

SoloFates_Gale_29.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Gale_29.text: *There's only one way to find out.*
SoloFates_Gale_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale, determined, the course is set

SoloFates_Gale_14.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Gale_14.text: *Within you, the orb strains against its confines. You sense Elminster's enchantment is beginning to fade. It will not be contained much longer, but that doesn't matter now.*

SoloFates_Gale_42.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Gale_42.text: *At last, the future unfolds before you. The power of Karsus in your hands. And no one, not the orb, not even the goddess of magic herself, is going to stop you.*
SoloFates_Gale_42.context: NodeContext: The orb is most definitely going to stop you, so maybe a hint of irony to the player's confidence here

SoloFates_Gale_15.speaker: Player
SoloFates_Gale_15.text: Reforge the Crown. Offer it to Mystra, hope that it's enough for her to cure you of the orb.

SoloFates_Gale_24.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Gale_24.text: *Hope. For so long you scarcely dared to think the word, never mind feel it. But you dare to feel it now. How could you not. You are loved. And you are at peace.*

SoloFates_Gale_32.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Gale_32.text: *Perhaps Mystra will recognise you for your humility, perhaps not.*

SoloFates_Gale_27.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Gale_27.text: *Of one thing you may be assured - the world will be safe from the Crown's power, thanks to you - the illithid that defeated a Netherbrain.*
SoloFates_Gale_27.context: NodeContext: morally good outcome for Gale who made sacrifices

SoloFates_Gale_40.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Gale_40.text: *Of one thing you may be assured - the world will be safe from the Crown's power, thanks to you - Gale of Waterdeep, the wizard who defeated a Netherbrain.*
SoloFates_Gale_40.context: NodeContext: morally good outcome for Gale

SoloFates_Gale_8.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Gale_8.text: *You felt the magic of Karsus draining from the stones as the Crown plummeted to the bottom of the Chionthar. A useless trinket, nothing more.*

SoloFates_Gale_45.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Gale_45.text: *At least the mortal world will be safe from the temptation of the Crown. But you...*

SoloFates_Gale_10.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Gale_10.text: *You are an illithid, your body ravaged by ceremorphosis, your mind prey to unfamiliar desires to consume, to devour.*

SoloFates_Gale_18.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Gale_18.text: *And what of the orb? Already you sense Elminster's enchantment fading. Will you still be able to prevent its explosion when you can barely control yourself?*

SoloFates_Gale_28.speaker: Player
SoloFates_Gale_28.text: You will claim the Crown of Karsus. It is your right. Your destiny.

SoloFates_Gale_20.speaker: Player
SoloFates_Gale_20.text: You will return the Crown of Karsus to Mystra. She may yet see fit to redeem you.

SoloFates_Gale_47.speaker: Player
SoloFates_Gale_47.text: You're an illithid now - new worlds are yours to explore, for as long as you still live.

SoloFates_Gale_43.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Gale_43.text: *You could start with Oryndoll, and perhaps later, Glyth itself. The world is yours to uncover, its stories yours to tell.*

SoloFates_Gale_21.speaker: Player
SoloFates_Gale_21.text: What does it matter? You're a mind flayer. This world is yours.

SoloFates_Gale_60.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Gale_60.text: *You have thwarted the illithid Grand Design. You have defeated three Chosen and a Netherbrain. You are miraculous, and you have earned the right to live.*

SoloFates_Gale_26.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Gale_26.text: *Your fate will be what you make of it. Now, you are your own master.*

SoloFates_Gale_54.speaker: Player
SoloFates_Gale_54.text: The risk to others is too great. You will have to take your life. But somewhere far away from here.

SoloFates_Gale_41.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Gale_41.text: *Perhaps the Underdark. With your death, you might even eradicate others of your kind from the face of this realm.*

SoloFates_Gale_31.speaker: Player
SoloFates_Gale_31.text: You've been away too long and left too many books unread. Your library is calling.

SoloFates_Gale_46.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Gale_46.text: *Not to mention a comfy armchair, a roaring fire, and a glass of fine wine.*

SoloFates_Gale_7.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Gale_7.text: *Waterdeep is waiting for you - it's time to go home.*

SoloFates_Gale_13.speaker: Player
SoloFates_Gale_13.text: Seek out Elminster's counsel - perhaps there's still a way to stabilise the orb for good.

SoloFates_Gale_57.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Gale_57.text: *No doubt the Old Mage will have much to say about your adventures, and you will have much to tell him. The only problem is - where to find him?*

SoloFates_Gale_0.speaker: Player
SoloFates_Gale_0.text: There are so many places you've yet to explore, and not much time left to see them. Better get started.

SoloFates_Gale_22.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Gale_22.text: *You've always been curious about Menzoberranzan - perhaps that would be a good place to start. And after that, Cormyr, or even the Feywild.*

SoloFates_Gale_50.speaker: Player
SoloFates_Gale_50.text: Someone should write of your adventures. What better biographer can there be than you?

SoloFates_Gale_30.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Gale_30.text: *You will be immortalised in legend - generations upon generations will celebrate the tale of Gale of Waterdeep - the wizard that defeated a Netherbrain.*

SoloFates_Gale_53.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Gale_53.text: *The Netherbrain is defeated, Faerûn is saved, but where you should feel peace within there is only anticipation, for the new day holds the promise of something greater still.*
SoloFates_Gale_53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale stands at a window, looking out over the Chionthar. If possible, a shot of the Chionthar.

SoloFates_Gale_5.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Gale_5.text: *The Crown is in the depths of the Chionthar, waiting for your summons. You have the means to reforge it, and revive the power of Netheril anew.*
SoloFates_Gale_5.context: NodeContext: Speaking of Gale, a mind flayer, who knows that he could reforge the Crown of Karsus - the very thing that allowed the Netherbrain to be dominated and become the Netherbrain

SoloFates_Gale_61.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Gale_61.text: *The Karsite Weave palpates within you - stirred by the very prospect.*
SoloFates_Gale_61.context: NodeContext: the power within Gale resonating at the prospect of more power

SoloFates_Gale_56.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Gale_56.text: *Once the Crown is restored, you could return it to Mystra, fulfilling her wishes, and ridding the mortal world of such temptation.
SoloFates_Gale_56.context: NodeContext: Gale is speculating one path he could take (the morally good one)

SoloFates_Gale_11.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Gale_11.text: *Or... you could take control of it for yourself, and become a god.*
SoloFates_Gale_11.context: NodeContext: Speculating on the other path Gale could take (the ambitious one) - becoming a god and having absolute power

SoloFates_Gale_19.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Gale_19.text: *One way or another, you will have to reckon with your god. It's time to speak to Mystra.*
SoloFates_Gale_19.context: NodeContext: The moment before Gale speaks to his god, Mystra

MystraGaleConfrontation_2.speaker: Mystra
MystraGaleConfrontation_2.text: So, Gale of Waterdeep, you have become the inheritor of Karsus' powers at last.
MystraGaleConfrontation_2.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Fade up on the majesty of the outer planes. All is quiet, still, tranquil, then - something begins to happen. A new constellation begins to form in the shape of Gale's tattoo, tendrils of Netherese magic flickering around him like flashes of lightning. Pure, unbirdled power. 

A second symbol forms, of a similar size to Gale's. This one in the shape of Mystra's sigil, its magic the purer white/blue of the Weave. Then, we see Gale - in god-human or god-illithid form. He stands on the rippling firmament of the outer planes, Mystra before him.NodeContext: Neutral, not giving anything away yet. Gale now has the complete Crown of Karsus in his possession, and has gained the equivalent power of a minor god.

MystraGaleConfrontation_8.speaker: Mystra
MystraGaleConfrontation_8.text: Tell me. What do you intend to do with them?
MystraGaleConfrontation_8.context: NodeContext: Neutral, not giving anything away yet. Gale now has the complete Crown of Karsus in his possession, and has gained the equivalent power of a minor god.

MystraGaleConfrontation_23.speaker: Gale
MystraGaleConfrontation_23.text: I came to surrender them. The Crown, the Karsite Weave - take it all.

MystraGaleConfrontation_1.speaker: Mystra
MystraGaleConfrontation_1.text: This offering cost you greatly. There is no hope in life as an illithid, devoid of soul and conscience.
MystraGaleConfrontation_1.context: NodeContext: respectful - Gale sacrificed his humanity to achieve what she asked.

MystraGaleConfrontation_34.speaker: Mystra
MystraGaleConfrontation_34.text: It is within my power to restore your soul, and your humanity, if you are willing to leave the mortal realms behind. Return with me, to Elysium.
MystraGaleConfrontation_34.context: NodeContext: respectful - Gale sacrificed his humanity to achieve what she asked. If he's willing to die on the mortal planes, she will restore his soul and body to him but in the heavens.

MystraGaleConfrontation_18.speaker: Gale
MystraGaleConfrontation_18.text: Thank you, but no. I have someone waiting for me.

MystraGaleConfrontation_12.speaker: Gale
MystraGaleConfrontation_12.text: Perhaps one day, but for now there is more I need to accomplish.

MystraGaleConfrontation_9.speaker: Gale
MystraGaleConfrontation_9.text: Being an illithid has its advantages. I'm content as I am.

MystraGaleConfrontation_11.speaker: Mystra
MystraGaleConfrontation_11.text: Then you are free to go with both my thanks and my promise - henceforth, your prayers will always be answered.

MystraGaleConfrontation_21.speaker: Gale
MystraGaleConfrontation_21.text: I'll consider your offer. Thank you.

MystraGaleConfrontation_29.speaker: Gale
MystraGaleConfrontation_29.text: I crave nothing more. Take me to Elysium.

MystraGaleConfrontation_17.speaker: Mystra
MystraGaleConfrontation_17.text: So be it. Gale of Waterdeep, Chosen of Mystra.
MystraGaleConfrontation_17.context: NodeContext: Sincere emotion - welcoming Gale back to his rightful place, the culmination of all his efforts. Should feel epic for the player - the last big line of their story, really - to have re-earned a place alongside their goddess.

MystraGaleConfrontation_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mystra transforms Mindflayer Gale back to his human form (hollow) and grabs Gale's hand. They return to Elysium.

MystraGaleConfrontation_13.speaker: Mystra
MystraGaleConfrontation_13.text: Spoken like the wizard you were meant to be.
MystraGaleConfrontation_13.context: NodeContext: Sincere, approving - this is a hard-won compliment for the player.

MystraGaleConfrontation_32.speaker: Mystra
MystraGaleConfrontation_32.text: You do a great service here. Not only for your goddess, but for magic itself. It will never be forgotten. Nor will I forget you.
MystraGaleConfrontation_32.context: NodeContext: Sincere acknowledgement of what Gale has done. A touch more personal at the end - letting the aloof persona slip, a glimpse of the closer bond Gale once shared with her

MystraGaleConfrontation_27.speaker: Gale
MystraGaleConfrontation_27.text: I only wanted to make things right. We need never see each other again.

MystraGaleConfrontation_10.speaker: Mystra
MystraGaleConfrontation_10.text: Go, Gale of Waterdeep. Your life is your own at last. It's time you went and lived it.
MystraGaleConfrontation_10.context: NodeContext: Sincere, well-meant. Potentially the last big line of the game so should feel epic/final

MystraGaleConfrontation_16.speaker: Gale
MystraGaleConfrontation_16.text: I want to be your Chosen once more. And this time, I won't let you down.

MystraGaleConfrontation_33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mystra gestures, and the comet on Gale's chest begins to glow, the magic of Karsus being drawn from his chest at last. He nods his thanks at mystra, who smiles and disappers. Then, Gale closes his eyes, contentment on his face, and lets her spell do its work. As the magic is drawn forth, Gale's symbol in the sky begins to fade/flicker. Then - with a brilliant FLASH it is gone. The outer planes are at peace once again, as is Gale.

MystraGaleConfrontation_28.speaker: Gale
MystraGaleConfrontation_28.text: I want you back, Mystra. I want us to be lovers again.

MystraGaleConfrontation_15.speaker: Mystra
MystraGaleConfrontation_15.text: You already love another, Gale. I see them, waiting for you. It is to them you must return.
MystraGaleConfrontation_15.context: NodeContext: Doing what's best for him - returning him to his partner. Sincerely meant, no hard feelings.

MystraGaleConfrontation_26.speaker: Mystra
MystraGaleConfrontation_26.text: Patience, Gale. All in good time...
MystraGaleConfrontation_26.context: NodeContext: Neither a no nor a yes, but with a hint of hope that it might be possible.

MystraGaleConfrontation_22.speaker: Gale
MystraGaleConfrontation_22.text: I will become a new kind of god. One with ambition.

MystraGaleConfrontation_19.speaker: Mystra
MystraGaleConfrontation_19.text: Ambition. A fitting domain, for that is the only thing you will have to offer your worshippers.
MystraGaleConfrontation_19.context: NodeContext: ice cold,dripping with scorn. Gale has proven the arrogant, hubristic fool she feared he was.

MystraGaleConfrontation_4.speaker: Mystra
MystraGaleConfrontation_4.text: Know this - the Weave will never answer to you. Set your 'ambition' to that purpose, and you will feel the wrath of a true god. One worthy of the name.
MystraGaleConfrontation_4.context: NodeContext: ice cold, Gale has threatened her, she's about to demonstrate the extent of her own powers in response.

MystraGaleConfrontation_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Her piece said, Mystra disappears. The tattoo on Gale's chest begins to glow, his powers coming fully into being. He smiles to himself - godhood is his. In the Astral expanse above him, his symbol appears, glowing with power.  The God of Ambition has arrived.

MystraGaleConfrontation_30.speaker: Gale
MystraGaleConfrontation_30.text: I'm here for your godhood, Mystra. I'm going to rule the Weave.

MystraGaleConfrontation_0.speaker: Mystra
MystraGaleConfrontation_0.text: You think yourself capable of it? Come then, let us put your ambition to the test.
MystraGaleConfrontation_0.context: NodeContext: ice cold, Gale has threatened her, she's about to demonstrate the extent of her own powers in response.

MystraGaleConfrontation_24.context: CinematicNodeContext: Human Mystra and Human/Illithid Gale adopt tense/prepared poses, confrontation brewing between them (not leading to actual combat on-screen). In the skies, both Mystra and Gale's symbols grow in intensity, becoming stormlike. Flashes of light, the rumble and crackle of magic building dangerously. Their clouds grow and exactly as they make contact with hear an almighty CRACKLE (magical storms making contact), then cut to black and hear-

MystraGaleConfrontation_31.speaker: Mystra
MystraGaleConfrontation_31.text: You should have remained mortal, Gale of Waterdeep. You would have lived longer.
MystraGaleConfrontation_31.context: NodeContext: Heavy with promise of conflict to come - potentially the last line of the main story so should send a chill up the spine

RomanceFates_Karlach_18.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Karlach_18.text: Karlach. You seem so different now.

RomanceFates_Karlach_43.speaker: Karlach
RomanceFates_Karlach_43.text: Before, all I cared about was survival. Now I think I'm ready to live.

RomanceFates_Karlach_27.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Karlach_27.text: I still love you, Karlach. I still want to be with you.

RomanceFates_Karlach_34.speaker: Karlach
RomanceFates_Karlach_34.text: I love you too. Before, that love was an irrepressible inferno. Now it is a calm, cool object of beauty.

RomanceFates_Karlach_33.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Karlach_33.text: I can see you're still yourself, but there's something else in there too. An illithid calm.

RomanceFates_Karlach_11.speaker: Karlach
RomanceFates_Karlach_11.text: Maybe you're right. I feel less... changeable. Less afraid. I feel ready for whatever is to come.

RomanceFates_Karlach_30.speaker: Karlach
RomanceFates_Karlach_30.text: At your side I have learned to make peace with death, to accept new life, to conquer all that stands in the way of us and our destiny.

RomanceFates_Karlach_10.speaker: Karlach
RomanceFates_Karlach_10.text: We are indomitable. And the life we lead will be legendary.

RomanceFates_Karlach_20.speaker: Karlach
RomanceFates_Karlach_20.text: Let us begin. Together as one.

RomanceFates_Karlach_1.speaker: Karlach
RomanceFates_Karlach_1.text: Somewhere quiet. Somewhere private. Somewhere we can ask a million questions and contemplate their answers.

RomanceFates_Karlach_42.speaker: Karlach
RomanceFates_Karlach_42.text: This is only the beginning, my love. We will reach heights of which our former selves could not conceive.

RomanceFates_Karlach_46.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Karlach_46.text: We accomplished so much together. We are a formidable team.

RomanceFates_Karlach_24.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Karlach_24.text: I have to admit, I'll miss the inferno.

RomanceFates_Karlach_16.speaker: Karlach
RomanceFates_Karlach_16.text: Those fires would have consumed me - and you, perhaps. But I promise to find new and interesting ways to keep you warm.

RomanceFates_Karlach_45.speaker: Karlach
RomanceFates_Karlach_45.text: You will be a helpful partner in my exploration of what it is to be - to be - alive.
RomanceFates_Karlach_45.context: NodeContext: emphasizing 'to be' - mind flayer Karlach is an existential philosopher

RomanceFates_Karlach_13.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Karlach_13.text: I think this is where we part ways, Karlach.

RomanceFates_Karlach_4.speaker: Karlach
RomanceFates_Karlach_4.text: I accept your assessment. You would have been an excellent helpmate in my exploration of what it is to live. But perhaps we are both of us too... changed.

RomanceFates_Karlach_37.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Karlach_37.text: Lady Shar needs me in Baldur's Gate.

RomanceFates_Karlach_36.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Karlach_36.text: Back to Waterdeep. I've a warm fire and a long-neglected reading list to get through.

RomanceFates_Karlach_2.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Karlach_2.text: Vlaakith's kith'raki will give chase. I'll need to stay one step ahead of them.

RomanceFates_Karlach_29.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Karlach_29.text: I hunt, I kill. It's what I know best.

RomanceFates_Karlach_0.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Karlach_0.text: I must cleanse the Coast and beyond of the fiends that threaten it.

RomanceFates_Karlach_17.speaker: Karlach
RomanceFates_Karlach_17.text: I will miss you. But I wish you luck.

RomanceFates_Karlach_28.speaker: Karlach
RomanceFates_Karlach_28.text: We have accomplished so much together. And will continue to achieve a great deal apart.

RomanceFates_Karlach_21.speaker: Karlach
RomanceFates_Karlach_21.text: Congratulations on your victories, and don't hesitate to call on me in future, if need should arise.

RomanceFates_Karlach_7.speaker: Karlach
RomanceFates_Karlach_7.text: I suppose this is goodbye. Soldier.

RomanceFates_Karlach_22.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Karlach_22.text: I'll remain in Baldur's Gate, guide it to a new era of peace and prosperity.

RomanceFates_Karlach_32.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Karlach_32.text: My duty is as it ever was: to protect the people of the Sword Coast.

RomanceFates_Karlach_38.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Karlach_38.text: To build up my power in Baldur's Gate. That city is ripe for the taking...

RomanceFates_Karlach_9.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Karlach_9.text: Back to the shadows, at least for now. But who knows what the future might hold?

RomanceFates_Karlach_35.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Karlach_35.text: Somewhere Cazador will never find me. Not before I'm ready to face him.

RomanceFates_Karlach_41.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Karlach_41.text: I just need some peace, and time alone.

RomanceFates_Karlach_8.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Karlach_8.text: Back to Baldur's Gate. It's time to rebuild - renew.

RomanceFates_Karlach_3.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Karlach_3.text: On a long, long holiday somewhere warm and quiet.

RomanceFates_Karlach_25.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Karlach_25.text: You're every bit as beautiful now as you always were.

RomanceFates_Karlach_44.speaker: Karlach
RomanceFates_Karlach_44.text: Thank you. But beauty no longer concerns me. This vessel, this flesh, is but a means to experience the depths within and without.

RomanceFates_Gale_49.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_49.text: It's curious. After all the wonders and monstrosities we've witnessed, waking beside you seems more unreal than any of it.
RomanceFates_Gale_49.context: NodeContext: Wistful/peaceful - spent a romantic night with the person he loves

RomanceFates_Gale_101.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_101.text: I'd forgotten what it felt like, to greet a sunrise without fear of it being my last.

RomanceFates_Gale_137.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_137.text: It's curious. After all the wonders and monstrosities we've witnessed, waking beside you seems more unreal than any of it.
RomanceFates_Gale_137.context: NodeContext: Wistful/peaceful - spent a romantic night with the person he loves

RomanceFates_Gale_117.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_117.text: I'd forgotten what it felt like, to greet a sunrise without fear of it being my last.

RomanceFates_Gale_151.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_151.text: It's curious. After all the wonders and monstrosities we've witnessed, waking beside you seems more unreal than any of it.
RomanceFates_Gale_151.context: NodeContext: Wistful/peaceful - spent a romantic night with the person he loves

RomanceFates_Gale_23.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_23.text: I'd forgotten what it felt like, to greet a sunrise without fear of it being my last.

RomanceFates_Gale_33.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_33.text: Oh, hells. I'm sorry. Barely awake a moment and I've already put my foot in it.
RomanceFates_Gale_33.context: NodeContext: Kicking himself, he's accidentally rubbed salt in his partner's very sore wound

RomanceFates_Gale_150.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_150.text: Don't be. At least one of us will get the cure we were hoping for.

RomanceFates_Gale_136.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_136.text: Don't be. It's not your fault.

RomanceFates_Gale_146.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_146.text: Come now - resignation doesn't suit you half as well as optimism. We'll find some other means of fixing up that infernal engine of yours.

RomanceFates_Gale_157.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_157.text: Knowing you, I'd expect nothing less.

RomanceFates_Gale_11.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_11.text: You always find a smile where others would soak in their sorrows. And I promise - you'll have reason to smile soon enough.

RomanceFates_Gale_94.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_94.text: When we get to Waterdeep, we'll search in my library. It's bound to contain the odd scroll on hellish thermodynamics. Or a spell that might diffuse the heat in such a way that -

RomanceFates_Gale_126.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_126.text: Ah. But I'm getting ahead of myself. Do you... that is, would you consider returning to Waterdeep with me?
RomanceFates_Gale_126.context: NodeContext: A bit nervous to ask - this is Karlach, after all

RomanceFates_Gale_53.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_53.text: I can't. My only hope of survival is to return to Avernus - and I'm not going back.

RomanceFates_Gale_20.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_20.text: What, then? You intend to die here? Now?
RomanceFates_Gale_20.context: NodeContext: Refuses to believe it - essentially been told his partner is submitting to her illness

RomanceFates_Gale_95.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_95.text: I'd love to, Gale, but I can't. My engine is done. Fully cooked.

RomanceFates_Gale_8.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_8.text: I - I don't believe it. I won't believe it.

RomanceFates_Gale_102.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_102.text: If you go were to return to the hells - temporarily - it would buy us some time. I could put something together, a means of keeping you stable at least. Please, let me try.
RomanceFates_Gale_102.context: NodeContext: Trying to convince her, scared by what she's saying (that she's ready to die)

RomanceFates_Gale_103.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_103.text: And hand myself to Zariel on a platter? No thanks.

RomanceFates_Gale_44.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_44.text: I'm not going back, Gale. I can't.

RomanceFates_Gale_110.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_110.text: What if... what if I went with you?
RomanceFates_Gale_110.context: NodeContext: Scared by his own suggestion

RomanceFates_Gale_3.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_3.text: I couldn't let you do that. You deserve better.

RomanceFates_Gale_86.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_86.text: I deserve the chance to live my life with the raging inferno I love. If that means relocating to the hells, so be it. I've heard Avernus is quite lovely this time of year.

RomanceFates_Gale_120.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_120.text: Besides, it would be quite something to study infernal magic in its natural environs. I say 'natural' in the loosest sense, of course.

RomanceFates_Gale_75.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_75.text: If you were with me, I might be able to handle it.

RomanceFates_Gale_56.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_56.text: There's nothing we can't handle - I promise you that.
RomanceFates_Gale_56.context: NodeContext: Essentially his partner just refused treatment for a terminal illness. He's putting a brave face on it so they can enjoy the time they have left.

RomanceFates_Gale_92.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_92.text: No, Gale. Neither of us is going to that pit. It all ends here. Now. I just want to see the sky one last time.

RomanceFates_Gale_29.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_29.text: If this is the end, then we face it together. That, at least, I can promise you.
RomanceFates_Gale_29.context: NodeContext: Heartbroken - his lover is dying next to him, thanking her for loving him

RomanceFates_Gale_48.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_48.text: Say nothing. Concentrate. You feel like you might explode any second.

RomanceFates_Gale_21.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_21.text: I know that look. It's your heart isn't it? Not to worry - you have one of the finest wizards in the Realms at your fingertips.

RomanceFates_Gale_96.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_96.text: Soon, I'll deliver the crown to Mystra, and be rid of the orb at long last. I'll be free.

RomanceFates_Gale_65.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_65.text: And what does freedom mean, for Gale of Waterdeep?

RomanceFates_Gale_50.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_50.text: Oh, him. I've been thinking a lot about that. 'Gale of Waterdeep', sounds a bit... pompous, don't you think?

RomanceFates_Gale_125.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_125.text: Free to come back to bed...

RomanceFates_Gale_37.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_37.text: We have all the time in the world for that. But first, there's something I wanted to talk to you about.

RomanceFates_Gale_24.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_24.text: I'm excited to meet this new you.

RomanceFates_Gale_68.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_68.text: I do feel like a new man. I was going to speak to you about that, as a matter of fact.

RomanceFates_Gale_160.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_160.text: You're lucky. I wish my own condition were so easily cured.

RomanceFates_Gale_52.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_52.text: Whatever for? I rather like this new you.

RomanceFates_Gale_89.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_89.text: In fact, your tentacular transformation has inspired me to make a little change of my own.

RomanceFates_Gale_2.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_2.text: You seem very relaxed. The orb isn't on the verge of exploding yet then?

RomanceFates_Gale_73.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_73.text: It's strange, but somehow I woke up this morning and realised the orb feels different. No clamour, no desperation, no hunger.
RomanceFates_Gale_73.context: NodeContext: 'And mine...' leading into explanation of his 'new dawn' on the next line

RomanceFates_Gale_152.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_152.text: I hesitate to say it, but I think it's... satisfied.

RomanceFates_Gale_45.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_45.text: I'll need to keep a careful study of it, make sure it's not suddenly destabilised by proximity to a rogue pair of Netherese sandals or what have you, but I think it's dormant.

RomanceFates_Gale_28.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_28.text: That's one worry I can leave behind me, at least.
RomanceFates_Gale_28.context: NodeContext: Hint of nerves, he's about to ask you to marry him...

RomanceFates_Gale_5.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_5.text: Was it Mystra's doing, do you think?

RomanceFates_Gale_60.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_60.text: It could be. Or perhaps the orb's hunger was fuelled by my own, and my contentment influences it in much the same way.

RomanceFates_Gale_19.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_19.text: That's how I feel with you - content. It's a rather unfamiliar feeling, I must say. Not something Gale of Waterdeep ever craved.

RomanceFates_Gale_9.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_9.text: You don't seem all that excited. Is something the matter?

RomanceFates_Gale_97.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_97.text: Not the matter, but there is a matter I wanted to speak to you about.

RomanceFates_Gale_14.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_14.text: I've decided to drop this whole 'Gale of Waterdeep' business. It's a bit... pompous, don't you think?

RomanceFates_Gale_147.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_147.text: That's a relief. Can't say I was thrilled at the prospect of chasing you around the Sword Coast snacking on trinkets.

RomanceFates_Gale_129.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_129.text: Quite. Though on the subject of our future plans, there was something I wanted to discuss with you.

RomanceFates_Gale_0.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_0.text: I thought I might take this opportunity to reinvent myself. Or uninvent myself, to be more accurate.

RomanceFates_Gale_54.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_54.text: You're now in the company of plain old Gale Dekarios - a most brilliant wizard of intentionally limited renown. At your service.
RomanceFates_Gale_54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale bows/presents himself as though introducing himself to the playerNodeContext: Introducing himself wiht some flair

RomanceFates_Gale_22.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_22.text: Now, I believe this is the moment where I should get to my point, so to speak.

RomanceFates_Gale_115.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_115.text: I love you, more than I've ever loved anyone, mortal or immortal. And you've proven your love for me in more ways than even the greatest mathematicians would dare to count.

RomanceFates_Gale_82.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_82.text: That being said, I wondered if you might consider accompanying me back to Waterdeep as a new member of the Dekarios clan?
RomanceFates_Gale_82.context: NodeContext: Nervous, he's promosing marriage, in a roundabout way

RomanceFates_Gale_6.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_6.text: Are you asking me to marry you?

RomanceFates_Gale_1.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_1.text: I suppose I am. Tara would be delighted. Not to mention my mother. But I'd be just as happy without such ceremony, so long as we're together.

RomanceFates_Gale_42.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_42.text: You'd really wish to marry me, in my present condition?

RomanceFates_Gale_35.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_35.text: Your 'present condition' is that you're the one I love. And your current form is merely a reflection of the depths of your sacrifice. It only makes me love you more.

RomanceFates_Gale_4.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_4.text: There will be some practicalities to iron out. The guest list, the venue, and we'll need to find a very open-minded cleric.

RomanceFates_Gale_133.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_133.text: I promise we'll make it work, if you'll have me?

RomanceFates_Gale_106.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_106.text: I'll marry you, but I can't live in Waterdeep.

RomanceFates_Gale_138.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_138.text: Then I go where you go. Waterdeep wouldn't be home without you, anyway.

RomanceFates_Gale_61.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_61.text: We'll need time to make the arrangements, of course. The catering alone will need to be quite extraordinary...
RomanceFates_Gale_61.context: NodeContext: Reference to 'catering' because player is now a mindflayer and therefore eats brains

RomanceFates_Gale_72.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_72.text: The day is young, and there are thousands more days ahead of us.

RomanceFates_Gale_59.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_59.text: The day is young, and there are thousands more days ahead of us.

RomanceFates_Gale_55.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_55.text: The day is young, and there are thousands more days ahead of us.

RomanceFates_Gale_155.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_155.text: The day is young, and there are thousands more days ahead of us.

RomanceFates_Gale_124.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_124.text: The day is young, and there are thousands more days ahead of us.

RomanceFates_Gale_64.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_64.text: We'll need time to make the arrangements of course - the Dekarios clan is scattered clan far and wide, and you'll have invites of your own to send out, I'm sure.

RomanceFates_Gale_123.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_123.text: I accept. I'll marry you, Gale Dekarios.

RomanceFates_Gale_116.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_116.text: I accept. I'll marry you, Gale Dekarios.

RomanceFates_Gale_18.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_18.text: Of course I will. On one condition: we adopt any children.

RomanceFates_Gale_93.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_93.text: You will? Oh, thank goodness for that.

RomanceFates_Gale_32.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_32.text: Our relationship is perfect as it is. But Waterdeep sounds like fun.

RomanceFates_Gale_84.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_84.text: You can't blame a fellow for trying. If you're contented as we are, then so am I.

RomanceFates_Gale_149.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_149.text: That does lead me to a more pressing matter. Exactly how large is your library?

RomanceFates_Gale_119.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_119.text: I love you, but I think the vampire spawn in the Underdark need me.

RomanceFates_Gale_130.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_130.text: It's taken me long enough to find you. I'll be damned if I'm letting you go.

RomanceFates_Gale_38.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_38.text: I'm sorry, Gale. You'll have to return to Waterdeep alone. I've my own path to follow.

RomanceFates_Gale_156.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_156.text: There remains only one matter to be resolved - for me, at least.

RomanceFates_Gale_66.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_66.text: I understand your purpose lies here, but I fear if I return to Waterdeep alone, my heart would remain here with you.

RomanceFates_Gale_57.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_57.text: And so, if you're at all amenable to the idea, I thought I could, perhaps, stay. There might even be room for two Dekarioses in Baldur's Gate?

RomanceFates_Gale_139.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_139.text: You'd really wish to marry me, in my present condition?

RomanceFates_Gale_26.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_26.text: I accept. I'll marry you, Gale Dekarios.

RomanceFates_Gale_67.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_67.text: I accept. The Vampire Ascendant would do well to have a Consort for his Palace.

RomanceFates_Gale_69.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_69.text: All the ducal heraldry has already been drawn up... I'll go for 'Dekarios-Ravengard' if you will.

RomanceFates_Gale_31.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_31.text: My Lady would not permit such a union, but it sounds wonderful, to remain close to one another.

RomanceFates_Gale_122.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_122.text: I've no interest in marriage. But life with you in Baldur's Gate sounds wonderful.

RomanceFates_Gale_36.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_36.text: I'm sorry, Gale. I need to make my own life here. It's time you returned to Waterdeep.

RomanceFates_Gale_90.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_90.text: I see. Well, I've no desire to stand in the way of the future you've chosen.
RomanceFates_Gale_90.context: NodeContext: disappointed but accepts it because he loves you

RomanceFates_Gale_47.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_47.text: If our love ends here, it was no less perfect for its brevity. I will remember it, and you, always.

RomanceFates_Gale_85.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_85.text: You're lucky. I wish my own condition were so easily cured.

RomanceFates_Gale_74.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_74.text: I could get used to that feeling.

RomanceFates_Gale_25.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_25.text: I think we'll have plenty of time to do just that.

RomanceFates_Gale_43.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_43.text: Wake me up this early again, and you won't see many more...

RomanceFates_Gale_80.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_80.text: Not a morning person, I take it? I can scratch that from the list of wonderfully ordinary things I've still to learn about you.

RomanceFates_Gale_99.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_99.text: I'm not normally one to rise with the birds myself, but something disturbed my sleep.

RomanceFates_Gale_107.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_107.text: It's equally strange to wake and feel the sun on this body. I'm not sure what to make of it.

RomanceFates_Gale_114.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Gale_114.text: Sure, rub it in why don't you...

RomanceFates_Gale_77.speaker: Gale
RomanceFates_Gale_77.text: Both of us have been blessed with a new dawn - you should feel no shame at the nature of yours. And mine...

KarlachInAvernus_2.speaker: Karlach
KarlachInAvernus_2.text: SFX only: A battle cry as Karlach runs toward the imp horde with her axe raised overhead.

KarlachInAvernus_5.speaker: Karlach
KarlachInAvernus_5.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Hellish scenery - The player steps through a portal into Avernus. Karlach follows behind them, either stepping through, or falling through, in a callback to her recruitment scene (burning).(Her first words since her dying scene.
(She stands up, and the fire calms.)
NodeContext: We're bridging the gap from her death scene here- she was nearly- dead; the player is probably in a high state of emotion and we want to keep the tone high for a moment here.

KarlachInAvernus_13.speaker: Karlach
KarlachInAvernus_13.text: It worked. My engine's calmed down.
KarlachInAvernus_13.context: NodeContext: (She holds her chest/ inhales. A little emotional, happy to live despite returning to this pit).

KarlachInAvernus_21.speaker: Karlach
KarlachInAvernus_21.text: I shouldn't have let you come here. This isn't going to be easy, you know. Zariel's going to come at us with everything she's got, and now Raphael's in the mix, too.
KarlachInAvernus_21.context: NodeContext: Beginning to bridge into soldier mode, acknowledging the player's sacrifice.

KarlachInAvernus_16.speaker: Karlach
KarlachInAvernus_16.text: I shouldn't have let you come here. This isn't going to be easy, you know. Zariel's going to come at us with everything she's got.
KarlachInAvernus_16.context: NodeContext: Beginning to bridge into soldier mode, acknowledging the player's sacrifice.

KarlachInAvernus_18.speaker: Karlach
KarlachInAvernus_18.text: Gods. Like clockwork. They'll be on us soon - but there's just enough time.
KarlachInAvernus_18.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Shot of horizon - imps scrambling toward her and the player on a distant hill.)

KarlachInAvernus_23.speaker: Karlach
KarlachInAvernus_23.text: Thought I was done with these...
KarlachInAvernus_23.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Digs in her pouch, pulls out two cigars in one hand.NodeContext: A little wistful, a little hardened

KarlachInAvernus_0.speaker: Karlach
KarlachInAvernus_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: She snaps, and a flame appears at the tip of her finger, lighting the cigar. She offers Wyll a cigar, he shakes his head. She offers the player one of the lit cigars as she speaks. NodeContext: (She snaps, and a flame appears at the tip of her finger. This snap triggers her fully into the current situation. Sadness is gone. Karlach Cliffgate is gone; Karlach Demonsbane is back. She offers Wyll a cigar, he shakes his head. She offers the player one of the lit cigars as she speaks. The subtext here is 'I would never have come back here, but I fucking love you, so let's do this thing together.')

KarlachInAvernus_4.speaker: Karlach
KarlachInAvernus_4.text: Imps are fast but careless. Don't let 'em tire you out - just get rid of 'em. And don't forget:
KarlachInAvernus_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach takes a puff of her cigar.NodeContext: (She takes a beat and puffs the cigar. The taste of the smoke brings her back into the Blood War. She gestures to the imps on the horizon with her cigar hand as she speaks; she's done this a thousand times.)

KarlachInAvernus_3.speaker: Karlach
KarlachInAvernus_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach takes a big drag on the cigar then flicks it across her body.NodeContext: (She puffs the cigar, then tosses it to the ground across her body, cool as fuck. Wryly, before speaking).

KarlachInAvernus_19.speaker: Karlach
KarlachInAvernus_19.text: Better let these fuckers know I'm back. And this time, I'm not alone.
KarlachInAvernus_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach, the Player, and potentially Wyll prepare to bring the fight to the Hells.NodeContext: (Equips her battle axeand glances at the player with a grin. She's about to run into the horde and kill a shitton of imps and devils. This isn't the life she wanted, but it's all she's got, and she's damn good at it. Fade to credits.)

KarlachInAvernus_11.speaker: Karlach
KarlachInAvernus_11.text: ...but then there was the Blade of Avernus.
KarlachInAvernus_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: She snaps, and a flame appears at the tip of her finger, lighting the cigar. She offers Wyll one of the lit cigars as she speaks. NodeContext: (She snaps, and a flame appears at the tip of her finger. This snap triggers her fully into the current situation. Sadness is gone. Karlach Cliffgate is gone; Karlach Demonsbane is back. She hands the player one of the lit cigars as she speaks. The subtext here is 'I would never have come back here, but I fucking love you, so let's do this thing together.')

KarlachInAvernus_12.speaker: Karlach
KarlachInAvernus_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: She snaps, and a flame appears at the tip of her finger, lighting the cigar. She offers the player one of the lit cigars as she speaks. NodeContext: (She snaps, and a flame appears at the tip of her finger. This snap triggers her fully into the current situation. Sadness is gone. Karlach Cliffgate is gone; Karlach Demonsbane is back. She hands the player one of the lit cigars as she speaks. The subtext here is 'I would never have come back here, but I fucking love you, so let's do this thing together.')

KarlachInAvernus_8.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Hellish scenery - The player steps through a portal into Avernus. Karlach follows behind them, either stepping through, or falling through, in a callback to her recruitment scene (burning).(Her first words since her dying scene.
(She stands up, and the fire calms.)
NodeContext: We're bridging the gap from her death scene here- she was nearly- dead; the player is probably in a high state of emotion and we want to keep the tone high for a moment here.

KarlachInAvernus_9.text: It worked. My engine's calmed down.
KarlachInAvernus_9.context: NodeContext: (She holds her chest/ inhales. A little emotional, happy to live despite returning to this pit).

KarlachInAvernus_20.speaker: Karlach
KarlachInAvernus_20.text: It worked. My engine's calmed down.
KarlachInAvernus_20.context: NodeContext: (She holds her chest/ inhales. A little emotional, happy to live despite returning to this pit).

KarlachInAvernus_6.speaker: Karlach
KarlachInAvernus_6.text: Gods. Like clockwork. They'll be on me soon - but there's just enough time.
KarlachInAvernus_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Shot of horizon - imps scrambling toward her and the player on a distant hill.)

KarlachInAvernus_22.speaker: Karlach
KarlachInAvernus_22.text: Thought I was done with these...
KarlachInAvernus_22.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Digs in her pouch, pulls out two cigars in one hand.NodeContext: A little wistful, a little hardened

KarlachInAvernus_1.text: Imps are fast but careless. Don't let 'em tire you out - just get rid of 'em. And don't forget:
KarlachInAvernus_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach takes a puff of her cigar.NodeContext: (She takes a beat and puffs the cigar. The taste of the smoke brings her back into the Blood War. She gestures to the imps on the horizon with her cigar hand as she speaks; she's done this a thousand times.)

KarlachInAvernus_17.speaker: Karlach
KarlachInAvernus_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach takes a big drag on the cigar then flicks it across her body.NodeContext: (She puffs the cigar, then tosses it to the ground across her body, cool as fuck. Wryly, before speaking).

KarlachInAvernus_7.text: Better let these fuckers know I'm back.
KarlachInAvernus_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach, the Player, and potentially Wyll prepare to bring the fight to the Hells.NodeContext: (Equips her battle axeand glances at the player with a grin. She's about to run into the horde and kill a shitton of imps and devils. This isn't the life she wanted, but it's all she's got, and she's damn good at it. Fade to credits.)

EvilEnding_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: The brain, flanked by a fleet of nautiloids, hovers above the Sword Coast toward the camera. Below it march the armies of the Absolute. Behind them, Baldur's Gate burns.

EvilEnding_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: cut to the avatar seated on a throne atop the brain, with half-illithid versions of their surviving companions standing on either side of them, chanting 'FOR THE ABSOLUTE'

EvilEnding_1.speaker: Player
EvilEnding_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Close up on the avatar's face (the one who made the final decision). They smile.NodeContext: With a smile - you're a god now

EvilEnding_0.speaker: Player
EvilEnding_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Close up on the avatar's face (the one who made the final decision). They smile.NodeContext: With a smile - you're a god now

TheHerosRevelry_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Brain emits one last death rattle as it sinks into Chionthar. City streets: a mother shields her child from impending mind flayer attack.|

TheHerosRevelry_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: |The shockwave goes through the streets. Mother, child, and mind flayers surprised. Mother takes heart, grabs a weapon and impales nearest mind flayer. Other citizens do the same throughout the city streets.|

TheHerosRevelry_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Town square: citizens realising they've won. VICTORY! Bells ring, a bard starts to sing.|

TheHerosRevelry_20.speaker: Narrator
TheHerosRevelry_20.text: *Everything you did, everything you sacrificed - it was worth it, for this.*

TheHerosRevelry_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Players are seen on the dock.

TheHerosRevelry_22.context: CinematicNodeContext: Players swim up on to the dock.

TheHerosRevelry_3.speaker: Narrator
TheHerosRevelry_3.text: *Jubilation rises across the city. Baldur's Gate will live to fight another day, and it's all because of you.*

TheHerosRevelry_13.speaker: Narrator
TheHerosRevelry_13.text: *You did what no one else could.*

TheHerosRevelry_10.speaker: Narrator
TheHerosRevelry_10.text: *You cured yourself and all the other infected.*

TheHerosRevelry_15.speaker: Narrator
TheHerosRevelry_15.text: *Your enemies have been crushed, and you are triumphant.*

TheHerosRevelry_7.speaker: Narrator
TheHerosRevelry_7.text: *The fates of gods and monsters were decided by your hand.*

TheHerosRevelry_21.speaker: Narrator
TheHerosRevelry_21.text: *History will remember you. The city will remember you.*

TheHerosRevelry_18.speaker: Narrator
TheHerosRevelry_18.text: *You are the saviour of Baldur's Gate.*

TheHerosRevelry_2.speaker: Narrator
TheHerosRevelry_2.text: *You have earned your place amongst the many storied legends of the Forgotten Realms.*

TheHerosRevelry_9.speaker: Narrator
TheHerosRevelry_9.text: *The balance of the world has been restored.*

TheHerosRevelry_1.speaker: Narrator
TheHerosRevelry_1.text: *You defeated the Netherbrain, and freed Faerûn from the threat of the Illithid Empire.*

TheHerosRevelry_8.speaker: Narrator
TheHerosRevelry_8.text: *Against all odds, you defeated a Netherbrain, and saved Baldur's Gate from ruin.*

TheHerosRevelry_23.speaker: Narrator
TheHerosRevelry_23.text: *The bells ring out, the citizens rejoice. Baldur's Gate will live to fight another day, and it's all because of you.*

TheHerosRevelry_16.speaker: Narrator
TheHerosRevelry_16.text: *The fight for the fate of Faerûn is won, and it's all because of you.*

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_5.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_5.text: *For a moment, you bask in quiet triumph. The Netherbrain is dead and the Grand Design is thwarted. But a warrior's heart is rarely still for long.*

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_62.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_62.text: *The Comet soon rises on the githyanki empire. Vlaakith will fall to Orpheus and his guard; the slates will be writ anew.*

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_45.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_45.text: *And what part do you mean to play? Will Lae'zel of K'liir wield a blade in the name of Mother Gith's son - or will she take up new causes, pursue different dreams?*

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_11.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_11.text: Call on a red dragon and follow Orpheus. Vlaakith must be vanquished for good.

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_9.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_9.text: *A pocket of psionic energy reaches out from your mind to Orpheus. Your plea has been heard.*

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_20.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_20.text: *The red dragon appears, poised to carry you to the True Heir. You will fight for githyanki liberation as a Warrior of the Comet.*
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_20.context: CinematicNodeContext: A dragon flies to Lae'zel. She mounts itInternalNodeContext: Orpheus is defeated, not ceremorphed Laezel Avatar

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_3.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_3.text: *You pause for just a moment, reflecting on the partner you leave behind, and the reunion you will share once the lich queen has fallen...*

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_17.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_17.text: *... before giving your dragon the command. Fly!*

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_10.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_10.text: *The future of the githyanki rests in your hands. And you know just how to mould it.*

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_22.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_22.text: *You pause for just a moment, reflecting on moments past and contemplating moments to come...*

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_43.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_43.text: It was on Faerûn that you learned how to be free. This is your home now.

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_60.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_60.text: *The threat of the Grand Design is over, but your people will never accept you back into their embrace.*

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_40.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_40.text: *What happens next will be by your design, and yours alone.*

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_32.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_32.text: *But you feel secure in your fate. You know there is something beyond ascension - liberation.*

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_50.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_50.text: You've found a lover, a partner. You will stay here, find your own way forward.

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_15.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_15.text: *For a moment, you bask in quiet triumph. The Netherbrain is dead; you've undermined the ghaik empire. But a warrior's heart is rarely still for long.*

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_33.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_33.text: *The time has come. You can call out to the Astral - and ascend.*

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_30.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_30.text: Speak the Rite of Ascension. Vlaakith, ik sa'ith. Vlaakith, tri na'sa'zhi!

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_8.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_8.text: *A pocket of psionic energy reaches out from your mind to the Astral Plane. Your plea has been heard.*

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_44.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_44.text: *The red dragon appears, poised to carry you to Tu'narath. The queen's covenant is fulfilled at last.*
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: A dragon flies to Lae'zel. She mounts itInternalNodeContext: Orpheus is defeated, not ceremorphed Laezel Avatar

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_39.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_39.text: *You shiver, perhaps out of fear, excitement, elation - or all three.*

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_61.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_61.text: *In the distant reaches of your mind, Vlaakith calls out her eternal promise. You will know the names of the stars and the will of the cosmos. You will ascend.*
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_61.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel flies off on the dragon and the scene is over.InternalNodeContext: Lae'zel flies off, never to be seen again.

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_57.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_57.text: *There is a great pause, as if the entire universe had gone quiet - and you know the truth.*

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_41.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_41.text: *Vlaakith has rejected you, for Orpheus still lives. The kith'raki will hunt you, gut you, and devour you. You are not Vlaakith's precious, but Vlaakith's prey.*

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_7.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_7.text: *Your fate belongs to you, and you alone. What will you make of it?*

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_38.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_38.text: Even without your queen's blessing, you have earned the right to survive.

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_4.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_4.text: *You have thwarted the illithid Grand Design. You have honoured your people, you have secured their future. Your duty is fulfilled.*

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_58.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_58.text: *Your fate will be what you make of it. Now, you are your own master.*

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_31.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_31.text: You will not live as your queen's reject. Take your own life.

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_6.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_6.text: *The blade feels cool as it pierces your flesh. There is no pain, only the need to sleep... sleep... sleep...*
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel illithid player guts herself with a dagger as her companions look on in horror. The epilogue will go on without her.

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_46.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_46.text: You need no one's blessing now. You have destroyed a Netherbrain. You will thrive.

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_48.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_48.text: *The world is yours for the taking. A world you have made your own.*

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_26.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_26.text: *The future beckons to you, Lae'zel of K'liir. It is time to step into the unknown.*

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_28.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_28.text: You have found affection and more on this rock. Stay, and pursue a new life.

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_16.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_16.text: *Vlaakith will call for your head and send the kith'raki. They will chase you to the ends of the many planes.*

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_13.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_13.text: *But you feel secure in your fate. You know there is something beyond ascension - companionship.*

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_23.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_23.text: You have seen through Vlaakith's lies. Turn your back on your queen.

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_34.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_34.text: *But you are now your own master. The world is yours for the taking. A world of countless possibilities.*

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_37.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_37.text: You have made allies and friends. Remain in Faerûn.

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_53.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_53.text: *For a moment, you bask in quiet triumph. The Netherbrain is dead and the Grand Design is thwarted. But a warrior's heart is rarely still for long.*

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_14.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_14.text: *Orpheus may be gone, but you can still carry his banner and write the slates anew.*

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_0.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_0.text: *Will Lae'zel of K'liir conquer Vlaakith in the name of Mother Gith's son - or will she take up new causes, pursue different dreams?*

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_27.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_27.text: Call for one of Orpheus' dragons. Vlaakith must be vanquished for good.

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_21.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_21.text: *A pocket of psionic energy reaches out from your mind to Orpheus's honour guard. Your plea has been heard.*

AvatarLaezelFinalChoice_42.speaker: Narrator
