ROM_RomanceFates_Astarion_115.text: How dare you! After all I've done for you - after everything I've sacrificed!

ROM_RomanceFates_Astarion_176.speaker: Astarion
ROM_RomanceFates_Astarion_176.text: But fine. If that's what you want, so be it.

ROM_RomanceFates_Astarion_192.speaker: Astarion
ROM_RomanceFates_Astarion_192.text: There are thousands of vampire spawn in the Underdark, just waiting for a leader. I'll find them.

ROM_RomanceFates_Astarion_155.speaker: Astarion
ROM_RomanceFates_Astarion_155.text: I wish you well out there. Just don't come knocking on my door - I'll have a lot of hungry mouths to feed.
ROM_RomanceFates_Astarion_155.context: NodeContext: A little bitter, but more a warning than a threat

ROM_RomanceFates_Astarion_69.speaker: Astarion
ROM_RomanceFates_Astarion_69.text: I can make my own way in the world. There's enough of it out there.

ROM_RomanceFates_Astarion_109.speaker: Astarion
ROM_RomanceFates_Astarion_109.text: And now I can see it all. At night, obviously.

ROM_RomanceFates_Astarion_15.speaker: Astarion
ROM_RomanceFates_Astarion_15.text: It is a pity, we were rather good together. I'll never forget it.

ROM_RomanceFates_Astarion_4.speaker: Astarion
ROM_RomanceFates_Astarion_4.context: NodeContext: [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player. Make it count :P]

ROM_RomanceFates_Astarion_124.speaker: Astarion
ROM_RomanceFates_Astarion_124.text: I'll find some nice, dark place where neither you nor Cazador will ever bother me again.

ROM_RomanceFates_Astarion_78.speaker: Player
ROM_RomanceFates_Astarion_78.text: Can't we enjoy ourselves for one day before worrying about the next threat?

ROM_RomanceFates_Astarion_244.speaker: Astarion
ROM_RomanceFates_Astarion_244.text: I suppose you're right. We've been through enough.

ROM_RomanceFates_Astarion_108.speaker: Player
ROM_RomanceFates_Astarion_108.text: I want to break up with you.

ROM_RomanceFates_Astarion_126.speaker: Astarion
ROM_RomanceFates_Astarion_126.text: You - what? Now? After all this?!

RaphaelCrownUpdate_44.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade in: Raphael in a void, addressing the camera as if speaking directly to the player.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_53.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_53.text: A thief, a liar, and a fool.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_33.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_33.text: We had an agreement, and you broke it. The Crown was supposed to be mine.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_52.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_52.text: Instead of delivering it to its true home in the Hells, you gifted it to Mystra.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_35.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_35.text: Instead of delivering it to its true home in the Hells, you allowed Gale Dekarios to deliver it to Mystra.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_72.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_72.text: I should snuff you out and make coin of your soul, but it will be more amusing to let you see the consequences of your actions.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_5.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_5.text: Do you really think that the Crown is safer in the hands of a goddess than in the claws of a devil?

RaphaelCrownUpdate_41.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_41.text: Look to the history of these Realms. It is not the devils but the gods who sunder, wreck and ruin - it is the gods who instigate each new crisis.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_30.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_30.text: It is the gods who almost brought doom to your world. I was merely a witness to their conspiracy.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_14.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_14.text: And I would have dealt fairly with you. I cannot say what Mystra will do.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_58.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_58.text: Perhaps the crown is a mere trinket to one of her power, or perhaps it is the key to unlocking some dreadful new potential in her portfolio.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_64.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_64.text: Time will tell, as it always does. Look to the heavens and pray for peace - but  prepare for a cataclysm.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_55.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade in: Raphael in a void, addressing the camera as if speaking directly to the player.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_26.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_26.text: A thief, a liar, and a danger to anyone foolish enough to trust you.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_42.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_42.text: Spurred on by your victory over the Netherbrain, you took it upon yourself to challenge Mystra for control of her domain.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_57.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_57.text: Your mad hubris tainted your otherwise brilliant mind.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_24.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_24.text: Obliterated by Mystra, you are but a fragment of what you were - all-but erased from existence as if you were an error in Mystra's ledger.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_18.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_18.text: Your life does not matter to me, but it wasn't the only thing lost. When you challenged Mystra, she took the Crown from you.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_70.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_70.text: Now it is out of my grasp once more. Either destroyed, or claimed by the goddess and hidden away where I cannot sense its presence.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_1.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_1.text: There is one consolation - what remains of your soul is mine now, a new resident in my House of Hope.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_36.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_36.text: We're going to have such fun together.
RaphaelCrownUpdate_36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade out on Raphael's terrible, satisfied smile.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_71.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_71.text: Gale Dekarios trusted you. And do you know what became of him?

RaphaelCrownUpdate_31.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_31.text: Spurred on by your victory over the Netherbrain, he took it upon himself to challenge Mystra for control of her domain.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_0.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_0.text: A good ally - a good friend - would have weaned him off the mad hubris that tainted his otherwise brilliant mind.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_6.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_6.text: A good person would have put a stop to his ambitions.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_29.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_29.text: You, by word and by deed, encouraged him to indulge his worst impulses, and now he is gone.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_2.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_2.text: Mystra obliterated him - erased him from existence as if he were an error in her ledger.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_65.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_65.text: His life does not matter to me, but Gale wasn't the only thing lost. When he challenged Mystra, he took the Crown with him.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_48.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_48.text: He thought it would give him an advantage, that it would protect him from the fury of a god. He was wrong.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_61.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_61.text: When Mystra eliminated Gale, the Crown was lost too. Either destroyed, or claimed by the goddess and hidden away where I cannot sense its presence.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_20.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_20.text: There is one consolation - Gale's soul is mine now, a new resident in my House of Hope. Perhaps you'll come to visit one day.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_67.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_67.text: My door is always open to old friends.
RaphaelCrownUpdate_67.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade out on Raphael's terrible, satisfied smile.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_56.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_56.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade in: Raphael in a void, addressing the camera as if speaking directly to the player.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_9.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_9.text: The Crown really is marvelous - I'm almost tempted to dig Karsus' soul out of whatever pit he's in so I can show him what his creation is capable of now it's in the right hands.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_34.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_34.text: My legions are beginning their assault on Zariel's Flying Fortress just about now - it will fall before the sun rises over Toril, and Avernus will be mine.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_45.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_45.text: Conquering the other Hells will be simplicity itself - some of the Archdevils are already making overtures of peace and promises of tribute.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_8.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_8.text: My dear father Mephistopheles is among them.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_17.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_17.text: Even he sees how the tide has turned. And with all Nine Hells under my command, I will end The Blood War - inferna victoria - and look for new worlds to conquer.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_49.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_49.text: It won't be long before I come knocking at your door.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_43.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade out on Raphael's terrible, satisfied smile.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_60.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_60.text: I owe you a debt of gratitude.
RaphaelCrownUpdate_60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade in: Raphael in a void, addressing the camera as if speaking directly to the player.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_38.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_38.text: The tadpole would have feasted on that impressive mind of yours if you hadn't fought so hard.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_63.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_63.text: But mere survival was not enough for you.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_13.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_13.text: It is thanks to you that Gale, the Wizard of Waterdeep, became Dekarios the Divine, god of ambition.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_66.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_66.text: Without you, he would not have survived the appetites of the tadpole.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_37.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_37.text: It would have feasted on that impressive mind of his, and all of his talent would have been snuffed out forever.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_19.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_19.text: But mere survival was not enough. Not for Gale, and not for you.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_10.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_10.text: Saving your world from the gods and monsters that threatened it wasn't enough.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_69.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_69.text: You wanted more, and the mad hubris that has always tainted you came to the fore. Now that the Crown is yours, you will make Celestia quake.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_59.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_59.text: Gale wanted more, and you encouraged him to ignore every sensible instinct, to ignore the lesson of Karsus' Folly, and to reach for the heavens.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_40.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_40.text: You were the spark that rekindled Gale's hubris, and set him on a course that will make Celestia quake.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_22.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_22.text: I longed for the Crown, to satisfy my own ambitions, and I was furious that it had escaped me again.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_4.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_4.text: But I have assessed the situation, pondered every variable, plotted every possible course... and I have come to realise that this is for the best.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_23.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_23.text: In time, long after your friends and family are gone, you will cause such division and chaos in these Realms that even the lords of the Hells will be aghast to see it.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_3.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_3.text: In time, long after you're gone, Gale Dekarios will cause such division and chaos in these Realms that even the lords of the Hells will be aghast to see it.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_47.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_47.text: Ambition. Such a delicious sin for mortalkind to indulge in - such a dreadful weapon for an immortal to wield.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_11.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_11.text: The gods will be sundered. And from their ruin, I will rise.
RaphaelCrownUpdate_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade out on Raphael's terrible, satisfied smile.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_21.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_21.text: You defied me, Wizard of Waterdeep, and you paid the price.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_16.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_16.text: I will admit, I was angry when you failed to deliver the Crown to me. Those who break a deal with this devil do not usually live to tell the tale.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_25.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_25.text: All is forgiven though. The Crown came to me, as promised, and the method of delivery was spectacular.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_32.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_32.text: You harnessed its power, as Karsus once did, and you too fell into ruin. You were halfway to heaven when the orb detonated, tearing you apart.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_51.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_51.text: All that remained were ashes, blood, tears... and the Crown. Always the Crown.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_7.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_7.text: Your decimation did not even leave a mark on it. And now, only a fragment of your soul remains... and it is mine.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_62.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_62.text: Ambition. Courage. Hope. They all burn you in the end.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_50.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_50.text: I will bend the Crown to my will now, and use its power to bring the Nine Hells under my command

RaphaelCrownUpdate_39.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_39.text: When that is done, I will need new worlds to conquer.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_27.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_27.text: Perhaps your soul will be part of my legions, Gale Dekarios. If enough of it remains when I'm done toying with it.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_12.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade out on Raphael's terrible, satisfied smile.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_54.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_54.text: It won't be long before I come knocking at your door.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_68.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_68.text: The decimation of Gale did not even leave a mark on it.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_46.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_46.text: Gale harnessed its power, as Karsus once did, and he too fell into ruin. He was halfway to heaven when the orb detonated, tearing him apart.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_15.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_15.text: You were the spark of ambition that rekindled Gale's ambitions, after Mystra had so cleverly put them to rest.

RaphaelCrownUpdate_28.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelCrownUpdate_28.text: And you are the reason he survived the appetites of the tadpole for so long.

RomanceFates_Halsin_112.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_112.text: When we joined battle for the last time, I did not want to presume we would survive. I assumed it might cost us our lives in order to save nature's realm.
RomanceFates_Halsin_112.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

RomanceFates_Halsin_28.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_28.text: I thought that would be the steepest price that could be asked of us. But I was wrong.
RomanceFates_Halsin_28.context:
NodeContext: 
Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

RomanceFates_Halsin_6.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_6.text: You made a choice that would cause most to tremble. You made a sacrifice far greater than merely laying down your life. Your whole future, utterly altered. The world is in your debt, and I am in awe of you.
RomanceFates_Halsin_6.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

RomanceFates_Halsin_100.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_100.text: I am glad you feel that way, for I fear what awaits you will be difficult. There are few places you could go where your new form will not inspire fear, anger... violence.
RomanceFates_Halsin_100.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

RomanceFates_Halsin_86.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_86.text: You need to remove yourself from that danger - go wherever you can find solitude, peace. Nature's realm is vast - it shall provide a place where you can be yourself.
RomanceFates_Halsin_86.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

RomanceFates_Halsin_82.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_82.text: A sorry prize, yes. One that I wish was not so... but the world has a narrow view of who can be its saviour.
RomanceFates_Halsin_82.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

RomanceFates_Halsin_30.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_30.text: But I know what you did. I shall not forget, and I shall make it my purpose to tell all of what you did for them.
RomanceFates_Halsin_30.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

RomanceFates_Halsin_0.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_0.text: I can start to do so almost immediately - the wars of late have left many with nowhere to turn... Many lost their families, their homes - some never had them to begin with.
RomanceFates_Halsin_0.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

RomanceFates_Halsin_34.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_34.text: Perhaps in time, I can trust them to meet their saviour. Perhaps you can come to visit us, and be treated with all the reverence you deserve. That day may be distant. But I shall do everything in my power to hasten it.
RomanceFates_Halsin_34.context:
NodeContext: A little hopeful that this may not be goodbye forever.
Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

RomanceFates_Halsin_91.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Halsin_91.text: You sell yourself short - this is your dream. If you want me to be part of it, your followers will listen.

RomanceFates_Halsin_117.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_117.text: That would surely test even the most open-minded... yet, perhaps I am wrong to hesitate.
RomanceFates_Halsin_117.context: NodeContext: Reconsidering a little. Could he actually find a way to stay with his mind flayer lover?

RomanceFates_Halsin_49.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_49.text: A new start must be without limits, or otherwise how would we ever know what we are capable of?
RomanceFates_Halsin_49.context: NodeContext: Reconsidering a little. Could he actually find a way to stay with his mind flayer lover?

RomanceFates_Halsin_113.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_113.text: Let us try. It would be a sorry dream that does not make room for all who would wish to partake in it. Nature will find its balance, and if we are worthy, it will provide us with harmony.
RomanceFates_Halsin_113.context: NodeContext: Throwing caution to the wind/giving tentacle love a chance.

RomanceFates_Halsin_12.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_12.text: But still... we had best make your introduction carefully, and gradually. After all they have been through, I would hate to frighten the children - and the adults, for that matter.

RomanceFates_Halsin_22.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Halsin_22.text: Farewell. I hope our paths cross again in the future.

RomanceFates_Halsin_109.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_109.text: As do I. Be safe. Seek peace. Let nature guard you and provide for you. And know that there are those who will keep you in their hearts, always.
RomanceFates_Halsin_109.context:
NodeContext: A little hopeful that this may not be goodbye forever.
Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

RomanceFates_Halsin_2.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_2.text: I wish it could be so... but a new task awaits me.
RomanceFates_Halsin_2.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

RomanceFates_Halsin_33.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Halsin_33.text: I saved the world. I deserve better.

RomanceFates_Halsin_70.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_70.text: You do. But I fear the world is ignorant to its debt, at least for now.
RomanceFates_Halsin_70.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

RomanceFates_Halsin_63.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Halsin_63.text: I feared this would be the case...

RomanceFates_Halsin_73.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_73.text: Because you are wise. You know the fear and mistrust that can grip people's hearts all too easily. There are cruel limits to who they can accept as their saviour.
RomanceFates_Halsin_73.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

RomanceFates_Halsin_20.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Halsin_20.text: It is the better of two beasts. At least I did not become Bhaal's.

RomanceFates_Halsin_88.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Halsin_88.text: Awe? You don't find me... unnatural?

RomanceFates_Halsin_24.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_24.text: I thought that last night would have proven otherwise. I know your true nature. It is still there. It still intoxicates me.
RomanceFates_Halsin_24.context:
NodeContext: Romanrtic longing, seeing through the player's new form
Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

RomanceFates_Halsin_107.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_107.text: But I fear what awaits you will be difficult. There are few places you could go where your new form will not inspire fear, anger... violence.
RomanceFates_Halsin_107.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

RomanceFates_Halsin_8.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_8.text: I fear what awaits you will be difficult. There are few places you could go where your new form will not inspire fear, anger... violence.
RomanceFates_Halsin_8.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

RomanceFates_Halsin_29.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Halsin_29.text: It was a mistake. There must have been another way.

RomanceFates_Halsin_27.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_27.text: Do not torment yourself with paths not taken. You did what was necessary.
RomanceFates_Halsin_27.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

RomanceFates_Halsin_79.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_79.text: When we joined battle for the last time, I did not want to presume we would survive. To feel your touch again seemed like a distant dream. That made last night all the sweeter.

RomanceFates_Halsin_105.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Halsin_105.text: Not to mention exhausting. I don't know where you get your energy from.

RomanceFates_Halsin_45.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_45.text: Do not be so modest - you gave as good as you got.

RomanceFates_Halsin_85.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Halsin_85.text: Why do I get the feeling you're about to say goodbye?

RomanceFates_Halsin_42.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_42.text: Because I am. At least for now.

RomanceFates_Halsin_90.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_90.text: Part of me wishes we could stay in this room forever, you and I... but there is a new dawn breaking. And I have a part to play.

RomanceFates_Halsin_7.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Halsin_7.text: I remember you saying you wanted to seek a way for everyone to live a better life.

RomanceFates_Halsin_108.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_108.text: The wars of late have left many with nowhere to turn... Many lost their families, their homes - some never had them to begin with.

RomanceFates_Halsin_37.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_37.text: They need help - help that this city cannot provide right now. I shall aid them to make a new place for themselves, in Thaniel's realm, under nature's watch.

RomanceFates_Halsin_43.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_43.text: Now is the time for us to take care of each other. Already, people are gathering to depart. The promise of a new life inspires great haste.

RomanceFates_Halsin_106.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_106.text: At last count, there were nine whole wagons of children in tow. They are my duty now. 'Daddy Halsin', they call me. Who am I to tell them otherwise?
RomanceFates_Halsin_106.context: NodeContext: Indulgent chuckle and shake of the head on 'Daddy Halsin'.

RomanceFates_Halsin_10.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_10.text: Better than Archdruid ever did. The old teachings could not have foreseen this world; I can see a new way to serve nature now - a path that all can follow, if they wish.

RomanceFates_Halsin_58.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Halsin_58.text: It seems your dream of a better life for all might just come to pass.

RomanceFates_Halsin_111.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_111.text: It is but a sprouting acorn for now, but given time and care, it could grow tall and mighty - and offer shelter to all who need it.
RomanceFates_Halsin_111.context: NodeContext: Modest but hopeful for the future

RomanceFates_Halsin_54.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_54.text: You must visit as soon as you can - there will be much for you to see, and not a soul among our numbers who will not wish to praise the saviour of Baldur's Gate.

RomanceFates_Halsin_72.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_72.text: And I... well, I shall have my own selfish reasons for wanting to see you again, if you wish the same.

RomanceFates_Halsin_41.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Halsin_41.text: 'Visit as soon as I can?' Don't be an ass, Halsin. I'll come with you right now.

RomanceFates_Halsin_56.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_56.text: You... you shall? But what about all that you'll miss out on? Your name will be feted in this city - there will be parades, medals, feasts, hands to be shaken, babies to be kissed...
RomanceFates_Halsin_56.context: NodeContext: Taken aback/doesn't dare to hope the player is being serious.

RomanceFates_Halsin_83.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Halsin_83.text: I've never been more sure. Ready when you are.

RomanceFates_Halsin_32.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_32.text: Well... then let us make haste. You have quite a few little fans who will be overjoyed to make your acquaintance.

RomanceFates_Halsin_93.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Halsin_93.text: Perhaps I'm being hasty. Perhaps we should go our separate ways.

RomanceFates_Halsin_89.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_89.text: Then I will watch the horizon for you each day, and fix your image in my mind each night, until I feel your touch again.

RomanceFates_Halsin_116.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Halsin_116.text: Our hearts roam free, remember? Tend to your new dream - our paths will cross if it's meant to be.

RomanceFates_Halsin_50.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_50.text: You are right, of course. There are no mistakes in nature - it is all a grand tapestry beyond mortal reckoning.

RomanceFates_Halsin_57.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_57.text: You live your life, and I shall live mine... but forgive me the odd hopeful glance towards the horizon, in search for you.
RomanceFates_Halsin_57.context: NodeContext: Understandng, with some hope/sign he'll still hold a candle for you

RomanceFates_Halsin_16.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Halsin_16.text: Time will tell, I suppose. I'm a busy adventurer.

RomanceFates_Halsin_98.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_98.text: Have no fear. I am exceedingly patient.
RomanceFates_Halsin_98.context: NodeContext: Undaunted and confident in the face of the player's coyness.

RomanceFates_Halsin_76.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Halsin_76.text: No. I think our paths are meant to diverge here.

RomanceFates_Halsin_9.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_9.text: I see... After all my years of living, I know all too well that nothing lasts forever. Yet a parting can sting, nonetheless.

RomanceFates_Halsin_51.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_51.text: But that just means what we shared was precious, and will live on in my memory. Thank you - I am a richer man for having met you.

RomanceFates_Halsin_21.speaker: Narrator
RomanceFates_Halsin_21.text: *You try to answer, but a tide of searing-hot pain crashes over you.*

RomanceFates_Halsin_17.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Halsin_17.text: Halsin, I... I can't... my engine...

RomanceFates_Halsin_35.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_35.text: Of course - somehow I'd hoped for a miracle. But of course, the only miracles are those we make ourselves.
RomanceFates_Halsin_35.context: NodeContext: Solemn - talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

RomanceFates_Halsin_97.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_97.text: You can still save yourself, Karlach. You can return to Avernus. It need not be forever. Just long enough to give yourself a chance.
RomanceFates_Halsin_97.context: NodeContext: Unwilling to give up - talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

RomanceFates_Halsin_53.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_53.text: To Avernus? The land of lost souls...? I cannot. There are people who depend on me now.
RomanceFates_Halsin_53.context: NodeContext: Torn between lover and responsibilities. Talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

RomanceFates_Halsin_52.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_52.text: At least... for now, they depend on me. But perhaps given time, their roots will grow strong enough that they can stand without me.
RomanceFates_Halsin_52.context: NodeContext: Some hope.Talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

RomanceFates_Halsin_110.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_110.text: I could seek you out, or you could return to me, if Avernus were to yield a cure.
RomanceFates_Halsin_110.context: NodeContext: Some hope.Talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

RomanceFates_Halsin_60.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_60.text: This need not be a parting, so long as you fight on. You and I can each roam apart, until nature compels our paths to cross once again.
RomanceFates_Halsin_60.context: NodeContext: Some hope.Talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

RomanceFates_Halsin_38.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Halsin_38.text: I'm not sure I can, Halsin. Not alone.

RomanceFates_Halsin_47.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_47.text: Do as you must, as shall I. We shall meet again. It is as sure as the break of dawn, or the spring thaw.
RomanceFates_Halsin_47.context: NodeContext: Sincere/romantic.Talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

RomanceFates_Halsin_23.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_23.text: You are afraid because you are alive, and you have something to lose. Hold on to that.
RomanceFates_Halsin_23.context: NodeContext: Sincere. Talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

RomanceFates_Halsin_74.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_74.text: I have responsibilities. People who are counting on me. But perhaps given time, their roots will grow strong enough that they can stand without me.
RomanceFates_Halsin_74.context: NodeContext: Some hope.Talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

RomanceFates_Halsin_48.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Halsin_48.text: No - never. I'd rather die here than try to survive there. All I want now is to see the sky one last time.

RomanceFates_Halsin_31.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_31.text: If this is what you truly want... I shall respect your wishes. But know that you shall not die - not truly. Nature's realm shall be yours. In the air, the trees, the waters.
RomanceFates_Halsin_31.context: NodeContext: Sadded but respectful. Talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

RomanceFates_Halsin_65.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_65.text: You shall live on. And wherever I go, I shall feel your presence, and you mine.
RomanceFates_Halsin_65.context: NodeContext: Sincere. Talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

RomanceFates_Halsin_64.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Halsin_64.text: Try to focus. The inferno in your chest is reaching fever pitch.

RomanceFates_Halsin_96.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_96.text: Karlach - you are in pain. Do not say otherwise. It is writ large across your face.
RomanceFates_Halsin_96.context: NodeContext: Concerned - talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

RomanceFates_Halsin_18.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Halsin_18.text: A new community, raised by your hands? I'd like to see that.

RomanceFates_Halsin_5.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_5.text: And so you shall, as soon as you come to visit - there will be much for you to see, and not a soul among our numbers who will not wish to praise the saviour of Baldur's Gate.

RomanceFates_Halsin_99.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_99.text: We are each free, as we always were... but that does not need to be the end.
RomanceFates_Halsin_99.context: NodeContext: 'You know me - I'm a free agent'

RomanceFates_Halsin_11.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_11.text: I wish we had been afforded more time together, but there is so much to do in the wake of the Absolute's defeat, and precious few hands with which to do it.

RomanceFates_Halsin_80.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Halsin_80.text: Forget the world - stay with me.

RomanceFates_Halsin_68.speaker: Halsin
RomanceFates_Halsin_68.text: I cannot. No matter how much I want to.

DeathofKarlach_0.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_0.text: I'm hot. Too hot. I think... I think this is it. The engine's finally cooked.
DeathofKarlach_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach in slowly immolating as she is using the last of her willpower to stay on the material plane

DeathofKarlach_113.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_113.text: Karlach, zhak vo'n'fynh duj. Know this - I am forever yours.

DeathofKarlach_170.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_170.text: Karlach... I thought after all we've survived, maybe one last miracle would rear its head... but no. I'm sorry.

DeathofKarlach_153.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_153.text: Karlach... the Lady of Loss takes everything in the end, but I thought we'd have some more time yet. I'm sorry.

DeathofKarlach_92.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_92.text: Karlach... I... I love you. You taught me the impossible. In all my immortality, I'll never forget you.

DeathofKarlach_38.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_38.text: Do not yield, Karlach. Stay with us. Stay with the ones who love you.

DeathofKarlach_171.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_171.text: I am. I can do this.

DeathofKarlach_73.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_73.text: We did it. I did it. The city's going to be all right. My friends are going to be all right. I can let go.

DeathofKarlach_16.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_16.text: Doesn't matter if you're ready, girl. It's time.

DeathofKarlach_60.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_60.text: This thing is fucking hot. I feel like I'm falling apart. Am I... is this...?

DeathofKarlach_134.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_134.text: I can't - I can't! Oh gods, it's getting worse!

DeathofKarlach_47.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_47.text: There's no point resisting. It's happening. I'm dying, and I can't stop it.

DeathofKarlach_179.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_179.text: I'm slipping. I can't hang on. I... what's happening?!

DeathofKarlach_2.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_2.text: No! There's still time - one last chance to find a way back to Avernus. I could live... in a way. I could live...

DeathofKarlach_100.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_100.text: All right. All right. But I have to go. Now.
DeathofKarlach_100.context: CinematicNodeContext: [Choices] Karlach on hands on knees state.

DeathofKarlach_148.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_148.text: You did everything you set out to do. It's time, honey.

DeathofKarlach_168.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_168.context:
CinematicNodeContext: She explodes in a great riot of colour and flames. 

From the ashes below, a wisp floats up, levels with the eyeline, then flies away, up, to the heavens.

DeathofKarlach_108.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_108.text: COME ON, DEATH! TAKE ME! I'M READY! I'M READY! I'M -
DeathofKarlach_108.context:
CinematicNodeContext: She explodes in a great riot of colour and flames. 

From the ashes below, a wisp floats up, levels with the eyeline, then flies away, up, to the heavens.

DeathofKarlach_141.context:
CinematicNodeContext: She explodes in a great riot of colour and flames. 

From the ashes below, a wisp floats up, levels with the eyeline, then flies away, up, to the heavens.

DeathofKarlach_116.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_116.text: Take me, then. Go on, death - I'm yours.

DeathofKarlach_146.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_146.text: Karlach, by the gods. I don't want to lose you...

DeathofKarlach_124.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_124.text: Karlach, please... I'm not ready to go on without you.

DeathofKarlach_130.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_130.text: Karlach, no. If we had taken control, if we had become Absolute, I could have saved you.

DeathofKarlach_119.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_119.text: Do not yield, Karlach. The world has need for you yet. I have need for you yet. Please.

DeathofKarlach_155.speaker: Lae'zel
DeathofKarlach_155.text: Karlach. Know you part us with honour. You are strong. You are ready.

DeathofKarlach_83.speaker: Gale
DeathofKarlach_83.text: No, Karlach. Stay with me, please. We've shared too much to part like this.

DeathofKarlach_194.speaker: Astarion
DeathofKarlach_194.text: Karlach, no - fight it. You're stronger than this, my friend.

DeathofKarlach_154.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
DeathofKarlach_154.text: If this is your end, face it with the courage you have shown in your life, Karlach.

DeathofKarlach_63.speaker: Wyll
DeathofKarlach_63.text: Karlach, the very best of us. You were always the hero. My hero.

DeathofKarlach_104.speaker: Shadowheart
DeathofKarlach_104.text: Karlach... I thought after all we've survived, maybe one last miracle would rear its head... but no. I'm sorry.

DeathofKarlach_184.speaker: Halsin
DeathofKarlach_184.text: Do not yield, Karlach. This is not your time.

DeathofKarlach_66.speaker: Jaheira
DeathofKarlach_66.text: We're here, soldier. You're not alone.

DeathofKarlach_192.speaker: Minsc
DeathofKarlach_192.text: Karlach - no. You will be well. Boo says you have many more battles to fight yet.

DeathofKarlach_34.speaker: Karlach
DeathofKarlach_34.text: I'm hot. Too hot. I think... I think this is it. The engine's finally cooked.

DeathofKarlach_191.speaker: Karlach
DeathofKarlach_191.text: We did it, soldier. The city's going to be all right. And so are you.
DeathofKarlach_191.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Her back is to the player; she's staring out at a vista. When she speaks she's a little strained, out of breath. On 'And so are you' she turns her head toward us; we see her in quarter profile.)

DeathofKarlach_48.speaker: Karlach
DeathofKarlach_48.text: Engine's finally cooked. Held on just long enough.
DeathofKarlach_48.context: CinematicNodeContext: (She turns around. Her engine is pulsating dangerously.)

DeathofKarlach_89.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_89.text: No, Karlach! Stay with me. We can still save you.

DeathofKarlach_123.speaker: Karlach
DeathofKarlach_123.context: CinematicNodeContext: She falls to her knees, holds a hand up as the player tries to approach her, says 'Careful - hot'. She's affected by the heat, it's starting to overwhelm her.

DeathofKarlach_156.speaker: Karlach
DeathofKarlach_156.text: It's the one thing I can't beat, isn't it? Same below as above. I love. You.
DeathofKarlach_156.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Her gaze moves upward, toward the sky, as though she's starting to lose consciousness. She looks at hte player on 'you' and says it with love).

DeathofKarlach_7.speaker: Karlach
DeathofKarlach_7.text: You. More than anything. I saw - gods!

DeathofKarlach_65.speaker: Karlach
DeathofKarlach_65.context: CinematicNodeContext: [Choices] Karlach on hands on knees state.

DeathofKarlach_72.speaker: Wyll
DeathofKarlach_72.text: No. Stop this. Come with me, Karlach. Come to Avernus. Live.

DeathofKarlach_14.speaker: Wyll
DeathofKarlach_14.text: We can't let her die - not like this, not now.

DeathofKarlach_136.speaker: Wyll
DeathofKarlach_136.text: No. Stop. I won't allow this. Karlach, you're coming with me - back to Avernus.

DeathofKarlach_117.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_117.text: It's your decision, Karlach. You have to choose.

DeathofKarlach_56.speaker: Wyll
DeathofKarlach_56.text: So? What do you say? Die here, now, or live on with the Blade of Avernus at your side? Zariel won't touch you. I swear it, Karlach.

DeathofKarlach_102.speaker: Karlach
DeathofKarlach_102.text: Fine. I'll go. Wyll. With you.
DeathofKarlach_102.context: CinematicNodeContext: [Choices] Karlach on hands on knees state.

DeathofKarlach_183.speaker: Karlach
DeathofKarlach_183.text: But we have to go. Now.
DeathofKarlach_183.context: CinematicNodeContext: [Choices] Karlach on hands on knees state.

DeathofKarlach_8.speaker: Wyll
DeathofKarlach_8.text: No. Stop. My love - We can save her. We can take her to Avernus.

DeathofKarlach_121.speaker: Wyll
DeathofKarlach_121.text: We can't let her die - not like this, not now.

DeathofKarlach_112.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_112.text: Go Karlach. Wyll will be with you; you won't be alone anymore.

DeathofKarlach_103.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_103.text: I love you, Wyll, but I can't follow you to Avernus. The two of you should go together.

DeathofKarlach_71.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_71.text: It's your decision, Karlach. You have to choose. Wyll will go with you. Zariel won't be able to touch you.

DeathofKarlach_41.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_41.text: It's your decision, Karlach. You have to choose. We'll go with you. Zariel won't be able to touch us.

DeathofKarlach_23.speaker: Wyll
DeathofKarlach_23.text: So? What do you say? Die here, now, or live on with people who love you. Zariel won't touch you. I swear it, Karlach.

DeathofKarlach_97.speaker: Wyll
DeathofKarlach_97.text: Thank the gods you've seen sense. Come! To Avernus we go - our next adventure awaits.

DeathofKarlach_96.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_96.text: Enough, Karlach. The three of us will make a new life in Avernus. Together.

DeathofKarlach_190.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_190.text: Karlach, my love, I can't watch you die. Wyll - I'll go with her. It should be me.

DeathofKarlach_76.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_76.text: Wyll, you've done enough. It should be me who goes with Karlach. You can still live, Karlach. We'll do it together. What do you say?

DeathofKarlach_82.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_82.text: No, Wyll. Karlach's made her choice time and again. She's ready to go.

DeathofKarlach_166.speaker: Wyll
DeathofKarlach_166.text: I can't force her. But I don't want to watch, either. I can't.

DeathofKarlach_36.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_36.text: No! No Karlach! I won't allow this. You're going to live. We're returning to Avernus. Together.

DeathofKarlach_32.speaker: Karlach
DeathofKarlach_32.context: CinematicNodeContext: [Choices] Karlach on hands on knees state.

DeathofKarlach_5.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_5.text: I know why you're afraid. I know why you don't want to go. But I'll be with you this time. I won't leave your side.

DeathofKarlach_126.speaker: Karlach
DeathofKarlach_126.text: All right. All right. But we have to go. Now.
DeathofKarlach_126.context: CinematicNodeContext: [Choices] Karlach on hands on knees state.

DeathofKarlach_64.speaker: Karlach
DeathofKarlach_64.text: I can't hang on much longer.
DeathofKarlach_64.context: CinematicNodeContext: [Choices] Karlach on hands on knees state.

DeathofKarlach_147.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_147.text: I won't watch you die. Let's go.

DeathofKarlach_78.speaker: Karlach
DeathofKarlach_78.text: H-hurry. I'm going to... I don't have much time...
DeathofKarlach_78.context: CinematicNodeContext: [Choices] Karlach on hands on knees state.

DeathofKarlach_35.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_35.text: You have to choose, Karlach. It's your last chance. Do we go to Avernus, together? Or would you rather die here in Faerûn?

DeathofKarlach_43.speaker: Karlach
DeathofKarlach_43.text: I thought I knew... I thought I knew, but you...
DeathofKarlach_43.context: CinematicNodeContext: [Choices] Karlach on hands on knees state.

DeathofKarlach_30.speaker: Karlach
DeathofKarlach_30.text: I'm ready. I... I... Stand back, I'm going to -
DeathofKarlach_30.context:
CinematicNodeContext: She explodes in a great riot of colour and flames. The player recoils against the light and heat.

From the ashes below, a wisp floats up, levels with the player, then flies away, up, to the heavens. [Choices] Karlach on hands on knees state.

DeathofKarlach_142.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_142.text: Stay with her. Watch her. Be here.

DeathofKarlach_55.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_55.text: You were spectacular in every way.

DeathofKarlach_160.speaker: Karlach
DeathofKarlach_160.text: For you. And for the city, and for myself, and blah, blah. But most of all, for you.
DeathofKarlach_160.context: CinematicNodeContext: (She approaches and puts a hand on the player's face. Then she staggers backward.)

DeathofKarlach_74.speaker: Karlach
DeathofKarlach_74.text: So were you. My friend. My companion. I adore you.
DeathofKarlach_74.context: CinematicNodeContext: She approaches and puts a hand on the player's shoulder, gives it a hearty shake. She staggers backward.

DeathofKarlach_158.speaker: Karlach
DeathofKarlach_158.context: CinematicNodeContext: She falls to her knees, holds a hand up as the player tries to approach her, says 'Careful - hot'. She's affected by the heat, it's starting to overwhelm her.

DeathofKarlach_187.speaker: Karlach
DeathofKarlach_187.text: I never gave up. I did my best. I did my best.
DeathofKarlach_187.context: CinematicNodeContext: Talking to self. Focusing through the agony of the fire, but still with her swagger.

DeathofKarlach_87.speaker: Karlach
DeathofKarlach_87.text: It's the one thing I can't beat, isn't it? I wanted to live. In my city. With my friends.
DeathofKarlach_87.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Her gaze moves upward, toward the sky, as though she's starting to lose consciousness. She looks at hte player on 'you' and says it with love).

DeathofKarlach_185.speaker: Karlach
DeathofKarlach_185.text: But life is for the living. And I saw - gods!

DeathofKarlach_95.speaker: Karlach
DeathofKarlach_95.text: And I'd do it again. Whatever it took. For the city. For the world. But most of all, for you.
DeathofKarlach_95.context: CinematicNodeContext: (She approaches and puts a hand on the player's face. Then she staggers backward.)

DeathofKarlach_45.speaker: Karlach
DeathofKarlach_45.text: We did. Together. And now it's done.
DeathofKarlach_45.context: CinematicNodeContext: She approaches and puts a hand on the player's shoulder, gives it a hearty shake. She staggers backward.

DeathofKarlach_115.speaker: Player
DeathofKarlach_115.text: It doesn't matter. It's over now.

DeathofKarlach_28.speaker: Karlach
DeathofKarlach_28.text: It matters, my love. What we did here matters. What we have... has been everything.
DeathofKarlach_28.context: CinematicNodeContext: (She approaches and puts a hand on the player's face. Then she staggers backward.)

DeathofKarlach_26.speaker: Karlach
DeathofKarlach_26.text: So it is. We gave this city back its life. We did that.
DeathofKarlach_26.context: CinematicNodeContext: She approaches and puts a hand on the player's shoulder, gives it a hearty shake. She staggers backward.

SoloFates_Laezel_14.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Laezel_14.text: *The Netherbrain is ended, the Grand Design is thwarted. You slept soundly for the first time in uncounted months.*

SoloFates_Laezel_3.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Laezel_3.text: *Yet your mind and muscles are restless. Your new home of Faerûn is laid out before you, vast and daunting...*

SoloFates_Laezel_2.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Laezel_2.text: *... but no more daunting than the warriors Vlaakith will send after you. You are Hshar'lak. An apostate.*

SoloFates_Laezel_8.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Laezel_8.text: *What comes next for Lae'zel of K'liir?*

SoloFates_Laezel_7.speaker: Player
SoloFates_Laezel_7.text: Seek far-off adventure. Make a name for yourself as a great warrior in new lands.

SoloFates_Laezel_17.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Laezel_17.text: *This rock, this planet of Toril, is not as craggy as the asteroids your once-home was nestled into. It is painted in meadow-greens and sea-blues.*

SoloFates_Laezel_18.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Laezel_18.text: *Yet there are mountains for climbing, ogre blood for spilling, and fellow warriors for fraternising. Yes - you could get used to that life.*

SoloFates_Laezel_6.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Laezel_6.text: *You've grown accustomed to the rock. Hells, maybe - just maybe - you're even fond of it.*

SoloFates_Laezel_12.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Laezel_12.text: *As for Vlaakith's kith'raki, let them come.*

SoloFates_Laezel_9.speaker: Player
SoloFates_Laezel_9.text: Go into hiding. The Undying Queen will not find you in those depths.

SoloFates_Laezel_11.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Laezel_11.text: *Deep crevasses, rocky caverns, raving beasts. The Underdark is the closest place you'll find to the asteroid you once called home.*

SoloFates_Laezel_4.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Laezel_4.text: *It will be a solitary existence, the kind you might have appreciated once. No unnecessary chatter, no menial tasks for whinging wastrels.*

SoloFates_Laezel_13.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Laezel_13.text: *You may find some kindred spirits among the duergar, but alliances will be rare - and friendships, even rarer.*

SoloFates_Laezel_16.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Laezel_16.text: *As for Vlaakith's kith'raki, let them search.*

SoloFates_Laezel_19.speaker: Player
SoloFates_Laezel_19.text: Settle in Baldur's Gate. Githyanki you might be, but you are still a saviour to the citizens.

SoloFates_Laezel_15.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Laezel_15.text: *You might well be a first: an independent githyanki to make a home in Baldur's Gate.*

SoloFates_Laezel_20.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Laezel_20.text: *Word will spread of the githyanki who freed the city from the Netherbrain's scourge. You won't be welcomed by everyone -*

SoloFates_Laezel_1.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_Laezel_1.text: *- but you won't be turned away. You can forge new alliances, perhaps even find new souls to call 'kin'.*

SoloFates_Karlach_15.speaker: Karlach
SoloFates_Karlach_15.text: Well, woman. Here I am. I did what I came here to do, and now it's done. I'm burning out. I'm burning out.

SoloFates_Karlach_0.speaker: Karlach
SoloFates_Karlach_0.text: That's over, I'm afraid. What comes next is... the end.

SoloFates_Karlach_18.speaker: Karlach
SoloFates_Karlach_18.text: Yes. Yes, I can. Yes. All I need is to see the sky one last time.

SoloFates_Karlach_34.speaker: Karlach
SoloFates_Karlach_34.text: I don't think I have any other choice. Unless I go back to the Hells.

SoloFates_Karlach_3.speaker: Karlach
SoloFates_Karlach_3.text: There has to be another way.

SoloFates_Karlach_6.speaker: Karlach
SoloFates_Karlach_6.text: I could return to the Hells. I could go back.

SoloFates_Karlach_1.speaker: Karlach
SoloFates_Karlach_1.text: It could be different this time. I'm different.

SoloFates_Karlach_20.speaker: Karlach
SoloFates_Karlach_20.text: Raphael will be causing mayhem down there. Zariel won't have time to bother with me.

SoloFates_Karlach_29.speaker: Karlach
SoloFates_Karlach_29.text: Maybe I could do some good...

SoloFates_Karlach_16.speaker: Karlach
SoloFates_Karlach_16.text: It's better than dying. I want to live. Even in the Hells.

SoloFates_Karlach_26.speaker: Karlach
SoloFates_Karlach_26.text: It'll take grit, but I've got that. It'll take a big fuck-off sword, but I've got one of those too. All right. I can do this.

SoloFates_Karlach_17.speaker: Karlach
SoloFates_Karlach_17.text: It's now or never. Goodbye, Faerûn. For now.

SoloFates_Karlach_21.speaker: Karlach
SoloFates_Karlach_21.text: No! I want to die in the world I love. Not struggle on in the world I hate.

SoloFates_Karlach_2.speaker: Karlach
SoloFates_Karlach_2.text: All right then. Let's do this. I just want to see the sky one more time before I go...

SoloFates_Karlach_28.speaker: Karlach
SoloFates_Karlach_28.text: I am Karlach. Karlach Cliffgate. Of Baldur's Gate.
SoloFates_Karlach_28.context: NodeContext: She's transformed into a mind flayer

SoloFates_Karlach_12.speaker: Karlach
SoloFates_Karlach_12.text: My condition has been cured. I will live. I will be who I was meant to be.

SoloFates_Karlach_10.speaker: Karlach
SoloFates_Karlach_10.context: NodeContext: She's transformed into a mind flayer

SoloFates_Karlach_5.speaker: Karlach
SoloFates_Karlach_5.text: No. We will be far more than we ever could have conceived.

SoloFates_Karlach_4.speaker: Karlach
SoloFates_Karlach_4.text: We will go beyond the glaring light of Faerûn - the light we missed so much before. We will retreat to her depths, to the very bowels of being, and discover...
SoloFates_Karlach_4.context: NodeContext: She's transformed into a mind flayer

SoloFates_Karlach_32.speaker: Karlach
SoloFates_Karlach_32.text: Who needs a heart when you have all this?
SoloFates_Karlach_32.context: NodeContext: A rather ominous ending for our mind flayer karlach

SoloFates_Karlach_30.speaker: Karlach
SoloFates_Karlach_30.text: Why limit ourselves? We can be all. We can be everything.

SoloFates_Karlach_14.speaker: Karlach
SoloFates_Karlach_14.text: We can rise to heights so far impossible to fathom. We will plumb the depths of the city, retreat to its deepest core and discover...

SoloFates_Karlach_19.speaker: Karlach
SoloFates_Karlach_19.text: For the better. And from this new vantage point, all is possible.

SoloFates_Karlach_7.speaker: Karlach
SoloFates_Karlach_7.text: Where once we gasped and begged and cried for the pleasures and fripperies of our old life in Faerûn, now we will be unafraid to plumb its depths. We will discover...

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_28.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_28.text: *You slept like a babe, straight through the night. Dreamless, thoughtless, and almost entirely free.*

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_42.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_42.text: *For the first time, you feel alone. Calm, you breathe.*

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_35.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_35.text: *Bhaal may have been your beginning, but he will not be your end.*

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_16.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_16.text: *Of all those you killed in your Father's name, one lingers in your mind even now.*

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_43.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_43.text: *Astarion. His death weighs upon you still.*

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_26.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_26.text: *Gale. His death weighs upon you still.*

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_7.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_7.text: *Karlach. Her death weighs upon you still.*

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_37.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_37.text: *Lae'zel. Her death weighs upon you still.*

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_46.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_46.text: *Wyll. His death weighs upon you still.*

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_49.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_49.text: *Shadowheart. Her death weighs upon you still.*

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_5.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_5.text: *Isobel, the Cleric of Selûne. Her death weighs upon you still.*

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_19.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_19.text: *A burden you will carry for the rest of your days, but fortunately you will not have to carry it alone.*
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_19.context: InternalNodeContext: Goes to RomanceFates (not the Dark Urge one, but the one with an origin companion, whoever that may be)

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_13.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_13.text: *Alfira, the Bard of the Emerald Grove. Her death weighs upon you still.*

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_47.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_47.text: *Quil, the dreaming Bard. Her death weighs upon you still.*

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_8.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_8.text: *You will never be able to undo all the death you once wrought in his name.*

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_40.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_40.text: *But what will you do, now that your life is your own?*

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_12.speaker: Player
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_12.text: I can still aid the Gate from the Undercity. Organise supply chains, raise gold for the hospitals.

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_2.speaker: Player
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_2.text: I will submit myself for study to the Society of Brilliance. More research into illithids and Bhaal's blood will make the world safer.

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_32.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_32.text: *A rush of pleasure wells up within you at the thought.*

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_38.speaker: Player
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_38.text: I will atone for my sins against the Baldurians by rebuilding their city.

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_41.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_41.text: *A rush of pleasure wells up within you at the thought.*

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_6.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_6.text: *You still do not know the full extent of the scars that you left, but you will heal them, one by one.*

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_44.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_44.text: *And once you have, the world will be yours, not to conquer, but to explore.*

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_29.speaker: Player
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_29.text: I want to find a family of my own. A real one.

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_17.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_17.text: *Your family will be what you make of it, who you love, who you choose.*

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_34.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_34.text: *But be careful lest you pen a tragic sequel to your tale.*

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_39.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_39.text: *Though you are not governed by your Father anymore, your blood bears his taint. If you were to have sires of your own, they would be born Bhaalspawn.*

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_1.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_1.text: *So choose well, choose wisely - to your own nature be true.*

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_9.speaker: Player
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_9.text: I will honour Astarion's memory, for the rest of my days.

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_4.speaker: Player
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_4.text: I will honour Gale's memory as best I can, for the rest of my days.

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_20.speaker: Player
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_20.text: I will honour Karlach's memory for the rest of my days. She should have died in battle not by my hand.

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_36.speaker: Player
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_36.text: I will honour Lae'zel's memory, for the rest of my days.

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_21.speaker: Player
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_21.text: I will honour Wyll's memory, for the rest of my days.

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_0.speaker: Player
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_0.text: I will honour Shadowheart's memory, for the rest of my days.

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_25.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_25.text: *Bittersweet it is to remember the life of one ended by your hand. But you are not that person anymore.*

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_30.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_30.text: *Now your future is your own, so live it wisely, live it well - to your own nature be true.*

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_50.speaker: Player
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_50.text: There's so much of this world I haven't seen - damn the stares I'll get - I will see it all!

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_27.speaker: Player
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_27.text: There's so much of this world I haven't seen - I will see it all. Starting now!

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_18.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_18.text: *A rush of pleasure wells up within you at the thought.*

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_24.speaker: Player
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_24.text: I will eradicate the cult of Bhaal. One cultist at a time.

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_48.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_48.text: *Somewhere, on the wind, you almost feel you hear a rumbling laugh.*

SoloFates_CustomAvatar_10.speaker: Narrator
SoloFates_CustomAvatar_10.text: *Father Bhaal loves no death more than that of his own children. He will welcome the challenge.*

SequeToElfsong_1.speaker: Narrator
SequeToElfsong_1.text: *It's over. And it's all because of you.*

SequeToElfsong_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Pan out from city showing citizens celebrating/victorious.|

SequeToElfsong_4.speaker: Narrator
SequeToElfsong_4.text: *You, who were destined to become a thrall.*

SequeToElfsong_6.speaker: Narrator
SequeToElfsong_6.text: *Thanks to you, there will be no Illithid Empire, no Death Gods' tyranny.*

SequeToElfsong_0.speaker: Narrator
SequeToElfsong_0.text: *You have earned your place amongst the legends of the Sword Coast.*

SequeToElfsong_3.speaker: Narrator
SequeToElfsong_3.text: *You are the saviours of Baldur's Gate.*

SequeToElfsong_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Segue to Elfsong Tavern where next scenes will take place. NB There may be no scenes after this so should also work in the case that this is the last thing we see before credits.|

RomanceFates_Minthara_118.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_118.text: The world wakes to a new dawn, and we are here to greet it.
RomanceFates_Minthara_118.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

RomanceFates_Minthara_6.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_6.text: Not as conquerors, but as saviours.

RomanceFates_Minthara_113.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_113.text: Saviours of a city that we must now leave forever.

RomanceFates_Minthara_41.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_41.text: I thought your mind had evolved, not degraded. Do you not see? No matter our deeds, we both have the semblance of villains now.

RomanceFates_Minthara_45.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_45.text: The people we saved will not thank us. They will hunt us, and kill us.

RomanceFates_Minthara_24.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Minthara_24.text: I should have taken control of the brain when I had the chance.

RomanceFates_Minthara_65.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Minthara_65.text: I am leaving, but not with you. We need to go our separate ways.

RomanceFates_Minthara_117.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_117.text: After all that we have done together, you would leave me now?

RomanceFates_Minthara_83.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_83.text: I want to go where you go.

RomanceFates_Minthara_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_0.text: The world wakes to a new dawn, and we are here to greet it.

RomanceFates_Minthara_121.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_121.text: Not as conquerors, but as saviours.

RomanceFates_Minthara_49.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Minthara_49.text: Doesn't it feel good to know that we did the right thing?

RomanceFates_Minthara_15.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_15.text: But despite everything we gave up when we destroyed the brain, it is good to be here with you.

RomanceFates_Minthara_104.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_104.text: Your body is gone, but your mind is more beautiful than ever. Before, I could hold all that you are in my thoughts.

RomanceFates_Minthara_71.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_71.text: Now, I mourn the loss of the tadpole, because I can only imagine the wonders it could show me if our minds locked together as they once did.

RomanceFates_Minthara_3.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_3.text: So am I, my love. Let us be monsters together.

RomanceFates_Minthara_51.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Minthara_51.text: Where do you suggest we go?

RomanceFates_Minthara_102.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_102.text: I can think of one place that would be a natural home for us both.

RomanceFates_Minthara_36.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_36.text: Perhaps it is time for my homecoming. An exile from Lolth and her mind flayer consort, leading a conquering horde on Menzoberranzan.

RomanceFates_Minthara_90.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_90.text: The battle would be legendary, and our kingdom would be magnificent.

RomanceFates_Minthara_67.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Minthara_67.text: Whatever I am - whatever I become - I need to figure it out alone.

RomanceFates_Minthara_58.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_58.text: You do not ever need to be alone.

RomanceFates_Minthara_98.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_98.text: Stay with me one more day. Let me see all that you are, and I will show you what I believe we can be.

RomanceFates_Minthara_59.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_59.text: Your mind may be too powerful a thing for me to change, but I shall try.

RomanceFates_Minthara_106.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Minthara_106.text: So you'll stay with me, and have a mind flayer as a consort?

RomanceFates_Minthara_81.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_81.text: In time, you will learn to master your form, and then you will be perfection.

RomanceFates_Minthara_17.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_17.text: No higher power can command or restrain us - we will assemble an army of thralls, and who then will be able to stand against us?

RomanceFates_Minthara_96.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_96.text: Perhaps now we can make our own destiny.

RomanceFates_Minthara_108.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Minthara_108.text: We can still conquer using our own strength and wits.

RomanceFates_Minthara_99.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_99.text: No more gods or monsters, no devils or demons to manipulate our fate.

RomanceFates_Minthara_74.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_74.text: We reclaimed our freedom, though everything was against us. What would you do with it?

RomanceFates_Minthara_73.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Minthara_73.text: We're heroes - let's enjoy the adulation of the people.

RomanceFates_Minthara_107.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_107.text: Ugh, the people. They could have been our subjects if we had only seized power when we had the chance.

RomanceFates_Minthara_100.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_100.text: Perhaps they still can be. Gratitude is an easy thing to exploit, and Baldur's Gate owes its continued existence to us.

RomanceFates_Minthara_43.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Minthara_43.text: We should visit your family in Menzoberranzan.

RomanceFates_Minthara_110.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_110.text: Yes, that would be good. I'm sure my mother has missed me - she likes competition.

RomanceFates_Minthara_28.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_28.text: We can put the Gondians back to work, rebuild the Steel Watch, and march on the Underdark with an unstoppable army at our back, and a song of conquest on our lips.

RomanceFates_Minthara_42.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_42.text: It will be a glorious homecoming, and you will make a beautiful monarch, ruling by my side.

RomanceFates_Minthara_7.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Minthara_7.text: With Gortash dead, Baldur's Gate needs new leadership.

RomanceFates_Minthara_8.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_8.text: I would have preferred to claim the whole world when we had the chance, but Baldur's Gate is not a bad place to start.

RomanceFates_Minthara_75.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_75.text: We can put the Gondians back to work, rebuild the Steel Watch, and march to Waterdeep with an unstoppable army at our back, and a song of conquest on our lips.

RomanceFates_Minthara_82.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_82.text: The Sword Coast will be our battlefield, and Baldur's Gate will be the founding city of a new dynasty.

RomanceFates_Minthara_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_2.text: My name belongs to my mother, so our House will have a new name - your name - and the world will learn to fear it.

RomanceFates_Minthara_111.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_111.text: But we can look to the future tomorrow... or the day after. Today, let us think only of ourselves in this moment. We have won a lifetime together.

RomanceFates_Minthara_18.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Minthara_18.text: Whatever we do, let's do it far from here.

RomanceFates_Minthara_40.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_40.text: A shame to go to all the effort of saving the city if we do not seize it, but rebuilding will be a formidable task.

RomanceFates_Minthara_101.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_101.text: Chult, Thay, Amn, Waterdeep... there is a world of wonders to discover, and boundless Realms to conquer.

RomanceFates_Minthara_1.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Minthara_1.text: Freedom feels hollow. I regret not seizing control of the brain.

RomanceFates_Minthara_91.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_91.text: As do I. But smile, my love, there are yet more worlds to conquer. Perhaps it is time for my homecoming.

RomanceFates_Minthara_116.speaker: Narrator
RomanceFates_Minthara_116.text: *Your engine screeches and grinds within your chest; the inferno is here - and there's no holding it back.*

RomanceFates_Minthara_115.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Minthara_115.text: I think there's only one road left for me to travel. My engine's cooked. It's time.

RomanceFates_Minthara_84.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_84.text: No, Karlach. I will not lose you - not today.

RomanceFates_Minthara_48.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_48.text: The engine can endure in Avernus - we can return there, together, and make Zariel regret ever laying eyes on you.

RomanceFates_Minthara_33.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Minthara_33.text: Concentrate. Try to contain the inferno threatening to consume you from within.

RomanceFates_Minthara_16.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_16.text: You have endured so much, Karlach, and survived it all. You need not endure this pain in silence.

RomanceFates_Minthara_11.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_11.text: I know what is happening. The engine is failing. You are dying.

RomanceFates_Minthara_87.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_87.text: I will not let that happen. I hoped we might be able to enjoy the spoils of the city, but we must return to Avernus at once.

RomanceFates_Minthara_109.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_109.text: We will make Zariel sorry she ever laid eyes on you.

RomanceFates_Minthara_53.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Minthara_53.text: I can't let you do that, Minthara. You deserve a better life than Avernus can offer.

RomanceFates_Minthara_44.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_44.text: Do not presume you know what I do and don't deserve. I have chosen you - and I will have what is mine.

RomanceFates_Minthara_39.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_39.text: Come, my darling. We have a realm to conquer.

RomanceFates_Minthara_112.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Minthara_112.text: All right - if you're by my side, I can bear it.

RomanceFates_Minthara_76.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_76.text: Whatever you cannot bear, I can take from you.

RomanceFates_Minthara_60.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Minthara_60.text: I can't. I swore I'd never go back, and I meant it.

RomanceFates_Minthara_95.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_95.text: Zariel is the last of your tormentors who lives. I will find her and punish her, whether you follow me or not.

RomanceFates_Minthara_89.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_89.text: Would you have me navigate the hells without a guide?

RomanceFates_Minthara_30.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Minthara_30.text: You're impossible. I love you. All right - let's go.

RomanceFates_Minthara_37.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_37.text: Good. We have faced so much together already - it is only right we test ourselves against an archdevil and her legions.

RomanceFates_Minthara_92.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Minthara_92.text: No, Minthara. I'm sorry. It's my time. All I want is to see the sky one last time before I go.

RomanceFates_Minthara_22.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_22.text: All of your strength, all of your passion... all of your fire. Extinguished. Such a waste.

RomanceFates_Minthara_105.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_105.text: I will never understand it, and I do not accept it. But if this is what you choose, I will stay with you until the end.

RomanceFates_Minthara_114.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Minthara_114.text: I'm sorry - I should have taken control of the brain.

RomanceFates_Minthara_57.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Minthara_57.text: It would have felt like serving Bhaal again. I am free.

RomanceFates_Minthara_35.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Minthara_35.text: I was afraid I wouldn't be able to handle all of that power.

RomanceFates_Minthara_21.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Minthara_21.text: Nobody should have that much power.

RomanceFates_Minthara_5.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_5.text: I think you are wrong. Given what you have become, there is nothing we can not do together.

RomanceFates_Minthara_80.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RomanceFates_Minthara_80.text: Perhaps you are right. This may be for the best.

RomanceFates_Shadowheart_0.speaker: Shadowheart
RomanceFates_Shadowheart_0.text: Last night was... an exception. I hope you understand that. The battle's won, our journey is over, and I need to take my place at Lady Shar's side.
RomanceFates_Shadowheart_0.context: NodeContext: Composing herself, morning after the night before. Arc: Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar, ultimately sacrificing (and subsequently forgetting) her parents, before assuming control over Shar's church.

RomanceFates_Shadowheart_65.speaker: Shadowheart
RomanceFates_Shadowheart_65.text: All this has been to bring me to this point, and now I'm finally here - thanks in no small part to you.
RomanceFates_Shadowheart_65.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar, ultimately sacrificing (and subsequently forgetting) her parents, before assuming control over Shar's church.

RomanceFates_Shadowheart_120.speaker: Shadowheart
RomanceFates_Shadowheart_120.text: Lady Shar's work is never-ending. I've cleansed the ranks of her followers, leaving only the faithful - the worthy.
RomanceFates_Shadowheart_120.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar, ultimately sacrificing (and subsequently forgetting) her parents, before assuming control over Shar's church.

RomanceFates_Shadowheart_57.speaker: Shadowheart
RomanceFates_Shadowheart_57.text: Now is the time to spread her word: so many have suffered greatly in recent times, gripped by pain and loss... They will rush to the Dark Lady's embrace.
RomanceFates_Shadowheart_57.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar, ultimately sacrificing (and subsequently forgetting) her parents, before assuming control over Shar's church.

RomanceFates_Shadowheart_18.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Shadowheart_18.text: I'm glad you finally found your place in the world.

RomanceFates_Shadowheart_154.speaker: Shadowheart
RomanceFates_Shadowheart_154.text: Not everyone would share that view, but you were always different, weren't you?
RomanceFates_Shadowheart_154.context: NodeContext: Appreciative of the player's attitude. Arc: Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar, ultimately sacrificing (and subsequently forgetting) her parents, before assuming control over Shar's church.

RomanceFates_Shadowheart_136.speaker: Shadowheart
RomanceFates_Shadowheart_136.text: In another life, this may not have been a parting. It may have been the start of something...
RomanceFates_Shadowheart_136.context: NodeContext: Wistful. Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar, ultimately sacrificing (and subsequently forgetting) her parents, before assuming control over Shar's church.

RomanceFates_Shadowheart_45.speaker: Shadowheart
RomanceFates_Shadowheart_45.text: ...but we made our choices, and must live with what we have - and what we've lost.
RomanceFates_Shadowheart_45.context: NodeContext: 'Such is life'. Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar, ultimately sacrificing (and subsequently forgetting) her parents, before assuming control over Shar's church.

RomanceFates_Shadowheart_186.speaker: Shadowheart
RomanceFates_Shadowheart_186.text: Still though, you know where the House of Grief is, and what lies beneath it. We all need to be unburdened, every now and again.
RomanceFates_Shadowheart_186.context: NodeContext: 'Who knows? Maybe we can reconnect' Arc: Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar, ultimately sacrificing (and subsequently forgetting) her parents, before assuming control over Shar's church.

RomanceFates_Shadowheart_119.speaker: Player
RomanceFates_Shadowheart_119.text: A pity you're so beholden to Shar. What you and I had was special.

RomanceFates_Shadowheart_21.speaker: Shadowheart
RomanceFates_Shadowheart_21.text: It was special, but also fleeting... as it was always going to be.
RomanceFates_Shadowheart_21.context: NodeContext: Wistful. Arc: Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar, ultimately sacrificing (and subsequently forgetting) her parents, before assuming control over Shar's church.

RomanceFates_Shadowheart_199.speaker: Shadowheart
RomanceFates_Shadowheart_199.text: Do you know why I love night orchids? In part, because they do not last. They bloom where few ever see them, and in that moment they're perfect. Then they return to the darkness that birthed them.
